commit_message:
Maintenance: Add functional tests for database sync task

This patch is adding functional tests for the task responsible for
fixing the database. Currently the resources covered are: Networks,
ports, routers, subnets, security groups and security group rules (apart
from delete, bug listed inline).

Note that router ports and floating IPs are still missing and will be
submitted on subsequently patches.

Partial-bug: #1752897
Change-Id: If523d68b53229934f19c99f9bcca5128d78e482b
(cherry picked from commit f69b68d7d36c79bba211648acd5939ee3e52cd7a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/37/594137/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2018 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from neutron.tests.unit.api import test_extensions from neutron.tests.unit.extensions import test_extraroute from neutron.tests.unit.extensions import test_securitygroup from networking_ovn.common import constants as ovn_const from networking_ovn.common import maintenance from networking_ovn.common import utils from networking_ovn.tests.functional import base from neutron_lib.api.definitions import external_net as extnet_apidef from neutron_lib import constants as n_const from neutron_lib import context as n_context class _TestMaintenanceHelper(base.TestOVNFunctionalBase): """A helper class to keep the code more organized.""" def setUp(self): super(_TestMaintenanceHelper, self).setUp() self._ovn_client = self.mech_driver._ovn_client self._l3_ovn_client = self.l3_plugin._ovn_client ext_mgr = test_extraroute.ExtraRouteTestExtensionManager() self.ext_api = test_extensions.setup_extensions_middleware(ext_mgr) sg_mgr = test_securitygroup.SecurityGroupTestExtensionManager() self._sg_api = test_extensions.setup_extensions_middleware(sg_mgr) self.maint = maintenance.DBInconsistenciesPeriodics(self._ovn_client) self.context = n_context.get_admin_context() def _api_for_resource(self, resource): if resource.startswith('security-group'): return self._sg_api else: return super(_TestMaintenanceHelper, self)._api_for_resource( resource) def _find_network_row_by_name(self, name): for row in self.nb_api._tables['Logical_Switch'].rows.values(): if (row.external_ids.get( ovn_const.OVN_NETWORK_NAME_EXT_ID_KEY) == name): return row def _create_network(self, name, external=False): data = {'network': {'name': name, 'tenant_id': self._tenant_id, extnet_apidef.EXTERNAL: external}} req = self.new_create_request('networks', data, self.fmt) res = req.get_response(self.api) return self.deserialize(self.fmt, res)['network'] def _update_network_name(self, net_id, new_name): data = {'network': {'name': new_name}} req = self.new_update_request('networks', data, net_id, self.fmt) res = req.get_response(self.api) return self.deserialize(self.fmt, res)['network'] def _create_port(self, name, net_id, security_groups=None, device_owner=None): data = {'port': {'name': name, 'tenant_id': self._tenant_id, 'network_id': net_id}} if security_groups is not None: data['port']['security_groups'] = security_groups if device_owner is not None: data['port']['device_owner'] = device_owner req = self.new_create_request('ports', data, self.fmt) res = req.get_response(self.api) return self.deserialize(self.fmt, res)['port'] def _update_port_name(self, port_id, new_name): data = {'port': {'name': new_name}} req = self.new_update_request('ports', data, port_id, self.fmt) res = req.get_response(self.api) return self.deserialize(self.fmt, res)['port'] def _find_port_row_by_name(self, name): for row in self.nb_api._tables['Logical_Switch_Port'].rows.values(): if (row.external_ids.get( ovn_const.OVN_PORT_NAME_EXT_ID_KEY) == name): return row def _create_subnet(self, name, net_id): data = {'subnet': {'name': name, 'tenant_id': self._tenant_id, 'network_id': net_id, 'cidr': '10.0.0.0/24', 'ip_version': 4, 'enable_dhcp': True}} req = self.new_create_request('subnets', data, self.fmt) res = req.get_response(self.api) return self.deserialize(self.fmt, res)['subnet'] def _update_subnet_enable_dhcp(self, subnet_id, value): data = {'subnet': {'enable_dhcp': value}} req = self.new_update_request('subnets', data, subnet_id, self.fmt) res = req.get_response(self.api) return self.deserialize(self.fmt, res)['subnet'] def _find_subnet_row_by_id(self, subnet_id): for row in self.nb_api._tables['DHCP_Options'].rows.values(): if (row.external_ids.get('subnet_id') == subnet_id and not row.external_ids.get('port_id')): return row def _create_router(self, name, external_gateway_info=None): data = {'router': {'name': name, 'tenant_id': self._tenant_id}} if external_gateway_info is not None: data['router']['external_gateway_info'] = external_gateway_info req = self.new_create_request('routers', data, self.fmt) res = req.get_response(self.api) return self.deserialize(self.fmt, res)['router'] def _update_router_name(self, net_id, new_name): data = {'router': {'name': new_name}} req = self.new_update_request('routers', data, net_id, self.fmt) res = req.get_response(self.api) return self.deserialize(self.fmt, res)['router'] def _find_router_row_by_name(self, name): for row in self.nb_api._tables['Logical_Router'].rows.values(): if (row.external_ids.get( ovn_const.OVN_ROUTER_NAME_EXT_ID_KEY) == name): return row def _create_security_group(self): data = {'security_group': {'name': 'sgtest', 'tenant_id': self._tenant_id, 'description': 'SpongeBob Rocks!'}} req = self.new_create_request('security-groups', data, self.fmt) res = req.get_response(self.api) return self.deserialize(self.fmt, res)['security_group'] def _find_security_group_row_by_id(self, sg_id): for row in self.nb_api._tables['Address_Set'].rows.values(): if (row.external_ids.get( ovn_const.OVN_SG_EXT_ID_KEY) == sg_id): return row def _create_security_group_rule(self, sg_id): data = {'security_group_rule': {'security_group_id': sg_id, 'direction': 'ingress', 'protocol': n_const.PROTO_NAME_TCP, 'ethertype': n_const.IPv4, 'port_range_min': 22, 'port_range_max': 22, 'tenant_id': self._tenant_id}} req = self.new_create_request('security-group-rules', data, self.fmt) res = req.get_response(self.api) return self.deserialize(self.fmt, res)['security_group_rule'] def _find_security_group_rule_row_by_id(self, sgr_id): for row in self.nb_api._tables['ACL'].rows.values(): if (row.external_ids.get( ovn_const.OVN_SG_RULE_EXT_ID_KEY) == sgr_id): return row def _add_router_interface(self, router_id, port_id): req = self.new_action_request('routers', {'port_id': port_id}, router_id, 'add_router_interface') res = req.get_response(self.api) return self.deserialize(self.fmt, res) def _find_router_port_row_by_port_id(self, port_id): for row in self.nb_api._tables['Logical_Router_Port'].rows.values(): if row.name == utils.ovn_lrouter_port_name(port_id): return row class TestMaintenance(_TestMaintenanceHelper): def test_network(self): net_name = 'networktest' with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'create_network'): neutron_obj = self._create_network(net_name) # Assert the network doesn't exist in OVN self.assertIsNone(self._find_network_row_by_name(net_name)) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the network was now created ovn_obj = self._find_network_row_by_name(net_name) self.assertIsNotNone(ovn_obj) self.assertEqual( neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # > Update new_obj_name = 'networktest_updated' with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'update_network'): new_neutron_obj = self._update_network_name(neutron_obj['id'], new_obj_name) # Assert the revision numbers are out-of-sync ovn_obj = self._find_network_row_by_name(net_name) self.assertNotEqual( new_neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the old name doesn't exist anymore in the OVNDB self.assertIsNone(self._find_network_row_by_name(net_name)) # Assert the network is now in sync ovn_obj = self._find_network_row_by_name(new_obj_name) self.assertEqual( new_neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # > Delete with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'delete_network'): self._delete('networks', new_neutron_obj['id']) # Assert the network still exists in OVNDB self.assertIsNotNone(self._find_network_row_by_name(new_obj_name)) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the network is now deleted from OVNDB self.assertIsNone(self._find_network_row_by_name(new_obj_name)) def test_port(self): obj_name = 'porttest' neutron_net = self._create_network('network1') with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'create_port'): neutron_obj = self._create_port(obj_name, neutron_net['id']) # Assert the port doesn't exist in OVN self.assertIsNone(self._find_port_row_by_name(obj_name)) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the port was now created ovn_obj = self._find_port_row_by_name(obj_name) self.assertIsNotNone(ovn_obj) self.assertEqual( neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # > Update new_obj_name = 'porttest_updated' with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'update_port'): new_neutron_obj = self._update_port_name(neutron_obj['id'], new_obj_name) # Assert the revision numbers are out-of-sync ovn_obj = self._find_port_row_by_name(obj_name) self.assertNotEqual( new_neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the old name doesn't exist anymore in the OVNDB self.assertIsNone(self._find_port_row_by_name(obj_name)) # Assert the port is now in sync. Note that for ports we are # fetching it again from the Neutron database prior to comparison # because of the monitor code that can update the ports again upon # changes to it. ovn_obj = self._find_port_row_by_name(new_obj_name) new_neutron_obj = self._ovn_client._plugin.get_port( self.context, neutron_obj['id']) self.assertEqual( new_neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # > Delete with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'delete_port'): self._delete('ports', new_neutron_obj['id']) # Assert the port still exists in OVNDB self.assertIsNotNone(self._find_port_row_by_name(new_obj_name)) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the port is now deleted from OVNDB self.assertIsNone(self._find_port_row_by_name(new_obj_name)) def test_subnet(self): obj_name = 'subnettest' neutron_net = self._create_network('network1') with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'create_subnet'): neutron_obj = self._create_subnet(obj_name, neutron_net['id']) # Assert the subnet doesn't exist in OVN self.assertIsNone(self._find_subnet_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id'])) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the subnet was now created ovn_obj = self._find_subnet_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id']) self.assertIsNotNone(ovn_obj) self.assertEqual( neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # > Update with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'update_subnet'): neutron_obj = self._update_subnet_enable_dhcp( neutron_obj['id'], False) # Assert the revision numbers are out-of-sync ovn_obj = self._find_subnet_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id']) self.assertNotEqual( neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the old name doesn't exist anymore in the OVNDB. When # the subnet's enable_dhcp's is set to False, OVN will remove the # DHCP_Options entry related to that subnet. self.assertIsNone(self._find_subnet_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id'])) # Re-enable the DHCP for the subnet and check if the maintenance # thread will re-create it in OVN with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'update_subnet'): neutron_obj = self._update_subnet_enable_dhcp( neutron_obj['id'], True) # Assert the DHCP_Options still doesn't exist in OVNDB self.assertIsNone(self._find_subnet_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id'])) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the subnet is now in sync ovn_obj = self._find_subnet_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id']) self.assertEqual( neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # > Delete with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'delete_subnet'): self._delete('subnets', neutron_obj['id']) # Assert the subnet still exists in OVNDB self.assertIsNotNone(self._find_subnet_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id'])) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the subnet is now deleted from OVNDB self.assertIsNone(self._find_subnet_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id'])) def test_router(self): obj_name = 'routertest' with mock.patch.object(self._l3_ovn_client, 'create_router'): neutron_obj = self._create_router(obj_name) # Assert the router doesn't exist in OVN self.assertIsNone(self._find_router_row_by_name(obj_name)) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the router was now created ovn_obj = self._find_router_row_by_name(obj_name) self.assertIsNotNone(ovn_obj) self.assertEqual( neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # > Update new_obj_name = 'routertest_updated' with mock.patch.object(self._l3_ovn_client, 'update_router'): new_neutron_obj = self._update_router_name(neutron_obj['id'], new_obj_name) # Assert the revision numbers are out-of-sync ovn_obj = self._find_router_row_by_name(obj_name) self.assertNotEqual( new_neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the old name doesn't exist anymore in the OVNDB self.assertIsNone(self._find_router_row_by_name(obj_name)) # Assert the router is now in sync ovn_obj = self._find_router_row_by_name(new_obj_name) self.assertEqual( new_neutron_obj['revision_number'], int(ovn_obj.external_ids[ovn_const.OVN_REV_NUM_EXT_ID_KEY])) # > Delete with mock.patch.object(self._l3_ovn_client, 'delete_router'): self._delete('routers', new_neutron_obj['id']) # Assert the router still exists in OVNDB self.assertIsNotNone(self._find_router_row_by_name(new_obj_name)) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the router is now deleted from OVNDB self.assertIsNone(self._find_router_row_by_name(new_obj_name)) def test_security_group(self): with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'create_security_group'): neutron_obj = self._create_security_group() # Assert the sg doesn't exist in OVN self.assertIsNone( self._find_security_group_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id'])) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the sg was now created. We don't save the revision number # in the Security Group because OVN doesn't support updating it, # all we care about is whether it exists or not. self.assertIsNotNone( self._find_security_group_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id'])) # > Delete with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'delete_security_group'): self._delete('security-groups', neutron_obj['id']) # Assert the sg still exists in OVNDB self.assertIsNotNone( self._find_security_group_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id'])) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the sg is now deleted from OVNDB self.assertIsNone( self._find_security_group_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id'])) def test_security_group_rule(self): neutron_sg = self._create_security_group() neutron_net = self._create_network('network1') self._create_port('portsgtest', neutron_net['id'], security_groups=[neutron_sg['id']]) with mock.patch.object(self._ovn_client, 'create_security_group_rule'): neutron_obj = self._create_security_group_rule(neutron_sg['id']) # Assert the sg rule doesn't exist in OVN self.assertIsNone( self._find_security_group_rule_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id'])) # Call the maintenance thread to fix the problem self.maint.check_for_inconsistencies() # Assert the sg rule was now created. We don't save the revision number # in the Security Group because OVN doesn't support updating it, # all we care about is whether it exists or not. self.assertIsNotNone( self._find_security_group_rule_row_by_id(neutron_obj['id'])) # > Delete # FIXME(lucasagomes): Maintenance thread fixing deleted # security group rules is currently broken due to: # https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1756123

commit_message:
fix validation of stable branches for independent deliverables

The wrong variable was being used to check for the existing
branch. Add some debug messages to show what we do find and fix that
variable so the right branch name is checked.

Change-Id: I758f6aa3fd0b983af1b83a922b40c3181ae48014
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add project templates for openstack-tox-lower-constraints

Currently many projects use it [1] and in many cases adding requirement
of neutron or horizon. Currently there are other templates that covers
this need for horizon and neutron for other base jobs (e.g. py3*).

This patch adds the following templates for the
openstack-tox-lower-constraints job:

  - openstack-lower-constraints-jobs
  - openstack-lower-constraints-jobs-horizon
  - openstack-lower-constraints-jobs-neutron

[1]:
http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=-%20openstack-tox-lower-constraints&i=nope&files=&repos=

Change-Id: Ied4fa97755941df31c228b1ec7d7fbecb7ddde66

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ia885606fe6fdfc652914c8dd5d5fd8d0d74ee32b
Story: #2002586
Task: #24314

commit_message:
scripts: Bump Ansible to 2.5.6

2.5.5 has a bug[1] in the pause module and it's breaking the deployments
in OPNFV. Lets bump to 2.5.6 to fix that.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/commit/67859c3476501d5d9839fd904aec55468d09593a

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/598246/
Change-Id: Ic1a41829442267b9dba52f0209ed2569cf373216

subject: Move the inspector boot management spec to backlog
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-23 08:55:51.000000000', 'files': ['specs/backlog/inspector-boot-management.rst', 'specs/not-implemented/inspector-boot-management.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs/commit/53984da2e406d2a094c043311e4efd767a862f77', 'message': "Move the inspector boot management spec to backlog

When implementing this spec two critical problems were found:
* PXEBoot.validate requires instance image parameters, so we cannot
  use it during inspection.
* PXEBoot.prepare_ramdisk tries to configure DHCP/PXE environment,
  which clashes with inspector's one and requires VIFs to be present.

This change also marks the inspector part as done in 8.0.0 and
puts the unsolved problems into the text for anyone who will want
to revive the spec.

Finally, the RFE link is changed to storyboard.

Change-Id: I5a2920b1416889aaaed725e4cb669c505c2ed0bf
"}]
commit_message:
Move the inspector boot management spec to backlog

When implementing this spec two critical problems were found:
* PXEBoot.validate requires instance image parameters, so we cannot
  use it during inspection.
* PXEBoot.prepare_ramdisk tries to configure DHCP/PXE environment,
  which clashes with inspector's one and requires VIFs to be present.

This change also marks the inspector part as done in 8.0.0 and
puts the unsolved problems into the text for anyone who will want
to revive the spec.

Finally, the RFE link is changed to storyboard.

Change-Id: I5a2920b1416889aaaed725e4cb669c505c2ed0bf

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

Manual step: remove Python 3.5 jobs from stable/ocata.

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I6ed278c8c4a66a3b5724aa9c9dd291f1ab6a7972
Story: #2002586
Task: #24312

commit_message:
Always lowercase role name

Due to [1] ansible always access servers lowcase. Also, in respect to [2], this
patch lowercase name which is use in fqdn, hostname, ssh_known_hosts and other
places.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/26850/commits/aa4278e5f3ac2fc70c18ebd2f135378fa76776c7
[2] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4343

Change-Id: Ib25832496d6504def436414b9c2903cbfe5854d4
Resolves: rhbz#1619556

commit_message:
doc: Additional fixes to the SR-IOV doc

- Add steps to ensure physnets VLAN ranges are configured, if necessary
- Add steps to ensure a network using the given physnet is configured
- Update nova scheduler options, which have been moved since Ocata
  (nova 15.0.0) [1]
- Simply some commands
- Some typo/grammar fixes

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/7d0381c91a6

Change-Id: Ida499bda2cc6b91230cc6595b049fe62957d55a3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/75/598175/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: On Ubuntu, modify the ``/etc/network/interfaces`` file: On Red Hat, modify the ``/sbin/ifup-local`` file:#. Verify that the VFs have been created and are in ``up`` state. For example: asterisk (``*``) can be used to match anything. For example, to match any domain, bus ``0a``, slot ``00``, and all functions: [ml2]#. Ensure your physnet is configured for the chosen network type. Edit the ``ml2_conf.ini`` file on each controller: .. code-block:: ini [ml2_type_vlan] network_vlan_ranges = physnet2 ``PciPassthroughFilter`` to ``[filter_scheduler] enabled_filters`` to enable this filter. Ensure ``[filter_scheduler] available_filters`` is set to the default of ``nova.scheduler.filters.all_filters``: [filter_scheduler] enabled_filters = RetryFilter, AvailabilityZoneFilter, ComputeFilter, ComputeCapabilitiesFilter, ImagePropertiesFilter, ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter, ServerGroupAffinityFilter, PciPassthroughFilter available_filters = nova.scheduler.filters.all_filtersEnable neutron-sriov-nic-agent (Compute) ---------------------------------------- #. Install the SR-IOV agent, if necessary.#. Ensure the SR-IOV agent runs successfully:#. Enable the neutron SR-IOV agent service.#. If it does not already exist, create a network and subnet for the chosen physnet. This is the network to which SR-IOV ports will be attached. For example: .. code-block:: console $ openstack network create --provider-physical-network physnet2 \ --provider-network-type vlan --provider-segment 1000 \ sriov-net $ openstack subnet create --network sriov-net \ --subnet-pool shared-default-subnetpool-v4 \ sriov-subnet $ net_id=`openstack network show sriov-net | grep "\ id\ " | awk '{ print $4 }'` #. Create the SR-IOV port. ``vnic-type=direct`` is used here, but other options $ openstack port create --network 84b18250-c0d3-4594-92d1-19328fb37da5 \ --vnic-type direct \ sriov-port $ openstack port create --network 84b18250-c0d3-4594-92d1-19328fb37da5 \ --vnic-type direct --binding-profile trusted=true \ sriov-port #. Get the ``id`` of the created port: .. code-block:: console $ port_id=`openstack port show sriov-port | grep "\ id\ " | awk '{ print $4 }'` $ openstack server create --flavor m1.large --image cirros-0.3.5 \ --nic port-id=$port_id \ test-sriov
deleted_lines: In Ubuntu, modifying the ``/etc/network/interfaces`` file: In Red Hat, modifying the ``/sbin/ifup-local`` file:#. Verify that the VFs have been created and are in ``up`` state: asterisk (*) can be used to match anything. For example, to match any domain, bus 0a, slot 00, and all functions: ``PciPassthroughFilter`` to ``scheduler_default_filters`` to enable ``PciPassthroughFilter`` by default. Also ensure ``scheduler_available_filters`` parameter under the ``[DEFAULT]`` section in ``nova.conf`` is set to ``all_filters`` to enable all filters provided by the Compute service. [DEFAULT] scheduler_default_filters = RetryFilter, AvailabilityZoneFilter, ComputeFilter, ComputeCapabilitiesFilter, ImagePropertiesFilter, ServerGroupAntiAffinityFilter, ServerGroupAffinityFilter, PciPassthroughFilter scheduler_available_filters = nova.scheduler.filters.all_filtersEnable neutron sriov-agent (Compute) ------------------------------------- #. Install the SR-IOV agent.#. Ensure the neutron sriov-agent runs successfully:#. Enable the neutron sriov-agent service. $ net_id=`neutron net-show net04 | grep "\ id\ " | awk '{ print $4 }'` #. Create the SR-IOV port. ``vnic_type=direct`` is used here, but other options $ port_id=`neutron port-create $net_id --name sriov_port --binding:vnic_type direct | grep "\ id\ " | awk '{ print $4 }'` $ port_id=`neutron port-create $net_id --name sriov_port --binding:vnic_type direct --binding:profile type=dict trusted=true | grep "\ id\ " | awk '{ print $4 }'` $ openstack server create --flavor m1.large --image ubuntu_14.04 --nic port-id=$port_id test-sriov

commit_message:
do not flush selection on "old" boot source

This fixes an issue introduced by watchers:
when page initialized images watchers called before
select boot source watcher.it leads to sutiation when
we specify selection from user input and flush it on
updateBootSource. as a result page come to
inconsistent state described in the bug.
Perhaps, this requires big refactoring but  in the
current patch we do not flush selection if boot type
was not changed. it allows to use image, snapshot,
volume from context as ctrl.selection.

Change-Id: I4b23071a2a9e2c02cc1f46713165e5cb5155894f
Closes-Bug: #1710890

commit_message:
build the redirects for the project-deploy-guide dynamically

Pass the list of maintained series to the template environment so we
can use that list to generate all of the redirects to the
project deploy guide pages instead of having to update the list of
series in two places.

The newton series is handled as a special case because it exists but
is not considered maintained.

Change-Id: I10794819260f1edd54e3711258ab715910ccf20f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

added_lines: * `OpenStack Installation Guides for Rocky <https://docs.openstack.org/rocky/install/>`_ Minimal deployment for Rocky ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ At a minimum, you need to install the following services. Install the services in the order specified below: * Identity service  `keystone installation for Rocky <https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/rocky/install/>`_ * Image service  `glance installation for Rocky <https://docs.openstack.org/glance/rocky/install/>`_ * Compute service  `nova installation for Rocky <https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/install/>`_ * Networking service  `neutron installation for Rocky <https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/rocky/install/>`_ We advise to also install the following components after you have installed the minimal deployment services: * Dashboard  `horizon installation for Rocky <https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/rocky/install/>`_ * Block Storage service  `cinder installation for Rocky <https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/rocky/install/>`_

commit_message:
tests: Use 'ansible_connection=local' for connecting to localhost

Right now, Ansible tries to SSH to localhost and it fails if public
key authentication is not configured (eg. vagrant boxes). Since we
are running tests on localhost we may as well use 'local' as connection
type to avoid the unnecessary SSH connection.

Change-Id: I938afdcc7a1b47a1c0da0ab92ff73bbcd3afac27

commit_message:
Make Tripleo non-voting on Rocky

We need to unblock Rocky for patches and can't wait longer for TripleO.
Once it starts working again we can revert this.

Change-Id: Iebd3fe6731b2e9a6fe4d4cc4d2c4d07d648549cb

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break
pep8 job due to the new rules.
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def
- W503 line break before binary operator

Change-Id: I40d386b44489e6847dd9c441b3feb56e099d252e

commit_message:
Create an openstack/placement project

This patch includes the changes necessary to bootstrap an
openstack/placement repo that contains code seeded
from https://github.com/EdLeafe/placement . That repo contains
a clone of openstack/nova filtered by the filter_git_history.sh
script from oslo.tools [1]. The result is a collection of the
files that make up the placement service, it's test and docs
and auxilliary stuff. It is not a working repo. It will be
made to work via a series of changes to be reviewed in gerrit
once the new repo is seeded. Initially those changes will be
fairly mechanical, to fix file and import paths, and to remove
unneeded files that were included in the results because they
were non-placement members of commit required in the filtering.

The first commit will add a .zuul.yaml file that sets up some
noop-jobs and non-voting versions of openstack-tox-functional,
openstack-tox-functional-py35, openstack-tox-py27, openstack-tox-py35,
openstack-tox-p27, openstack-tox-pep8. As changes to the gerrit repo
progress, the jobs will be made voting and additional jobs will be added
for docs, api-ref, etc. Eventually the configuration will be update
to use templates.

The placement-core gerrit group will initially be seeded with the
existing nova-core group and a small number of additional people
selected from existing placement contributors.

The openstack/placement repo will initially be a part of the official
nova project. A patch indicating those plans will be made to governance.
It will depend on this change.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo.tools/tree/filter_git_history.sh

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/598380
Change-Id: Icab8e931e5ae589eab0038ca12e6b5bdba04ff43

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Id985bb7bcc50e1286f5221612d3a4684c9824049
Story: #2002586
Task: #24314

commit_message:
Add ensure_lbaas_package to neutron::server

Adds a new parameter ensure_lbaas_package same as for the other
service provider plugins. This can be used to only install the
LBaaS package and not the agents so that the neutron-server can
load the plugin.

Change-Id: I7f074fe3f8d3935d18f640de0d8a256f39ea8b11
(cherry picked from commit c70e4fa7f29c4ea183e3dd8f54549a6a0643307b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/91/598391/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Added new parameter neutron::server::ensure_lbaas_package that if set to true will install the neutron LBaaS package so that you can load that service_provider.

commit_message:
Add system storage resource support

Adds the system storage resource of Redfish standard schema.
This new resource represents the properties of a storage subsystem
that represents a set of storage resources consisting of storage
controllers (physical or virtual), volumes and physical disk drives.
The storage volumes are built from physical disks managed by the
controllers.

This patch introduces the properties ``max_volume_size_bytes`` and
``max_drive_size_bytes`` from the StorageCollection resource to
expose the sizes of the largest storage devices (volumes and drives)
available to the System.

Story: 1668487
Task: 12506

Change-Id: If2b5114a04e2de91d3f126cd8a9af3c9c62837df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/63/561863/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

""" # unset the attribute self._drives = None # invalidate the attribute if self._volumes is not None: self._volumes.invalidate(force) class StorageCollection(base.ResourceCollectionBase): """This class represents collection of Storage resource instances""" _max_drive_size_bytes = None _max_volume_size_bytes = None @property def _resource_type(self): return Storage @property def max_drive_size_bytes(self): """Max size available in bytes among all device resources.""" if self._max_drive_size_bytes is None: self._max_drive_size_bytes = ( max([storage_.drives.max_size_bytes for storage_ in self.get_members()])) return self._max_drive_size_bytes @property def max_volume_size_bytes(self): """Max size available in bytes among all Volumes under this.""" if self._max_volume_size_bytes is None: self._max_volume_size_bytes = ( max([storage_.volumes.max_size_bytes for storage_ in self.get_members()])) return self._max_volume_size_bytes def _do_refresh(self, force=False): # unset the attribute/s self._max_drive_size_bytes = None self._max_volume_size_bytes = None

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-27 13:03:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/health/__init__.py', 'neutron/plugins/common/health.py', 'neutron/plugins/common/constants.py', 'neutron/common/topics.py', 'neutron/common/health.py', 'neutron/services/health/health_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/279011b6bf991439a3a42eb16efd099e26e5a245', 'message': '[DO NOT MERGE] Health service plugin

Health service plugin implements health check execution support for all
plugins available in the neutron server. Health service plugin maintains
a list of available health checks.

When a health check execution is requested, the health service plugin
determines check implementation according to combination of resource name
and check name (when health of particular resource has been requested
using its ID), or a combination of collection name and check name (when
no ID has been specified). The actual diagnostics is delegated to the
health check implementation.

Other plugins are expected to inherit HealthCheckBaseInPlugin mixin
available from neutron/plugins/common/health.py. Unless customization of
health check search paths is required, it is the only change required to
enable other plugins support for health checking.

and agents in neutron/common/health.py. These functions are used to
dynamically determine available health checks. The functions follow the
same pattern that is already used for dynamic loading of API extensions.

commit_message:
[DO NOT MERGE] Health service plugin

Health service plugin implements health check execution support for all
plugins available in the neutron server. Health service plugin maintains
a list of available health checks.

When a health check execution is requested, the health service plugin
determines check implementation according to combination of resource name
and check name (when health of particular resource has been requested
using its ID), or a combination of collection name and check name (when
no ID has been specified). The actual diagnostics is delegated to the
health check implementation.

Other plugins are expected to inherit HealthCheckBaseInPlugin mixin
available from neutron/plugins/common/health.py. Unless customization of
health check search paths is required, it is the only change required to
enable other plugins support for health checking.

Common health check discovery functions are available both for plugins
and agents in neutron/common/health.py. These functions are used to
dynamically determine available health checks. The functions follow the
same pattern that is already used for dynamic loading of API extensions.

Related-Bug: 1507499
Change-Id: I564b8fb52db16f4a49c102b9ad350a13d7b6dc05
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/322158/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 OpenStack Foundation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import contextlib from oslo_log import log as logging import oslo_messaging from neutron import manager from neutron._i18n import _LI, _LW from neutron.common import health from neutron.common import rpc as n_rpc from neutron.common import topics from neutron.common import utils from neutron.plugins.common import constants from neutron.services import service_base LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) HEALTH_RPC_VERSION = "1.0" class HealthPlugin(service_base.ServicePluginBase): """Implementation of the Health Plugin. This class implements a health plugin that provides diagnostic services for resources and collections. This plugin does not have any entries in database. """ supported_extension_aliases = [] _health_checks = None def __init__(self): super(HealthPlugin, self).__init__() target = oslo_messaging.Target(topic=topics.HEALTHPLUGIN, version=HEALTH_RPC_VERSION) self.client = n_rpc.get_client(target) # TODO(hmlnarik) Configurable check paths # self.check_paths = cfg.CONF.health_checks.split(os.pathsep) self.check_paths = None def get_plugin_description(self): """returns string description of the plugin.""" return "Health plugin for diagnostics of Neutron resources." def get_plugin_type(self): return constants.HEALTH def health_check(self, context, collection, resource, check_name=None, resource_id=None, **kwargs): if resource_id is None: lookup_name = HealthPlugin._get_collection_check_unique_name( check_name, collection) else: lookup_name = HealthPlugin._get_resource_check_unique_name( check_name, resource) check = self.health_checks.get(lookup_name) if not check: LOG.warning(_LW("Unknown check: %(check)s for " "resource: %(res) / collection: %(col)"), {"check": check_name, "res": resource, "col": collection}) return # TODO(hmlnarik): check and filter arguments passed in to prevent # passing in unknown parameters check_parameters = kwargs rpc_caller = HealthCheckRpcCaller(self.client, context) return check.execute(rpc_caller, resource_id, **check_parameters) def has_checks_for_collection(self, collection): """ Returns true if there is any check defined for a given collection in API (exposed via e.g. "/ports/health") :param collection: Collection name, e.g. "ports" :return: see above """ return any([collection in check.get_applicable_collections() for check in self.health_checks.values()]) def has_checks_for_resource(self, resource): """ Returns true if there is any check defined for a given resource in API (exposed via e.g. "/port/{port_id}/health") :param resource: Resource name, e.g. "port" :return: see above """ LOG.debug("%s:%s", resource, [check.get_applicable_resources() for check in self.health_checks.values()]) return any([resource in check.get_applicable_resources() for check in self.health_checks.values()]) @property def health_checks(self): """ Map of all defined health checks. Key is a unique check name, value is a health check instance. """ if self._health_checks is None: check_paths = self.check_paths if not check_paths: check_paths = [] plugins = manager.NeutronManager.get_unique_service_plugins() for plugin in plugins: if plugin and hasattr(plugin, "get_health_check_paths"): paths = plugin.get_health_check_paths() or [] check_paths.extend(paths) self._get_all_heath_checks(check_paths) return self._health_checks @utils.synchronized("health_checks_ready") def _get_all_heath_checks(self, check_paths): # Perform double checking for checks could have already been loaded if self._health_checks is not None: return self._health_checks = {} for check in health.load_health_checks(check_paths): LOG.info(_LI("Registering \"%(check)s\" health check for " "resources %(res)s and collections %(col)s"), {'check': check.get_name(), 'res': check.get_applicable_resources(), 'col': check.get_applicable_collections()}) int_names = HealthPlugin._get_check_unique_names(check) if not set(int_names).isdisjoint(self._health_checks.keys()): LOG.warning(_LW("Check \"%(check)s\" for resources %(res)s" " and collections %(col)s collides with" " already registered check." " Current check will take precedence."), {'check': check.get_name(), 'res': check.get_applicable_resources(), 'col': check.get_applicable_collections()}) self._health_checks.update({name: check for name in int_names}) @staticmethod def _get_check_unique_names(check): return ( [HealthPlugin._get_resource_check_unique_name(check.get_name(), r) for r in check.get_applicable_resources()] + [HealthPlugin._get_collection_check_unique_name(check.get_name(), c) for c in check.get_applicable_collections()] ) @staticmethod def _get_resource_check_unique_name(check_name, resource): return "R/%s/%s" % (resource, check_name) @staticmethod def _get_collection_check_unique_name(check_name, collection): return "C/%s/%s" % (collection, check_name) class HealthCheckRpcCaller(object): """ Object that is specifically targetted to invoke remote health_check method with appropriate parameters. Instances of this objects are used in health check execute() method, see HealthCheckBaseInPlugin class. """ def __init__(self, client, context): self.client = client self.context = context def in_context(self, new_rpc_context): """ Returns HealthCheckRpcCaller with updated RPC context. This can be used e.g. to change the privileges assigned to the RPC method. :param new_rpc_context: New RPC context :return: """ return HealthCheckRpcCaller(self.client, new_rpc_context) @contextlib.contextmanager def prepare(self, **rpc_prepare_args): """ Changes the client RPC parameters when preparing the call. :param rpc_prepare_args: See RPCCLient.prepare arguments :return: Object that can be directly used to invoke RPC method """ cctxt = self.client.prepare(**rpc_prepare_args) rpc_context = self.context class Caller(object): def _call(self, check_name, **check_args): return cctxt.call(rpc_context, 'health_check', check_name=check_name, check_args=check_args) def _cast(self, check_name, **check_args): return cctxt.cast(rpc_context, 'health_check', check_name=check_name, check_args=check_args) def __getattr__(self, check_name): return lambda **args: self._call(check_name, **args) yield Caller() def call(self, called_check_name, **check_args): """ Calls the health check using RPCClient.call method from oslo messaging. :param called_check_name: :param check_args: Arguments of the health check. :return: result of the RPCClient.call """ with self.prepare() as p: return p.called_check_name(**check_args) def cast(self, called_check_name, **check_args): """ Casts the health check using RPCClient.cast method from oslo messaging. :param called_check_name: :param check_args: Arguments of the health check. :return: result of the RPCClient.cast """ with self.prepare() as p: p._cast(called_check_name, **check_args)

commit_message:
Remove DATABASE_PASSWORD var

Given that those variables are defined and used by Devstack in its
initialize_database_backends function[1], it's not required to define
them. Otherwise, the instructions described in the process to setup
the environment for functional tests[2] cannot be completed.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/lib/database#n89
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/devref/development.environment.html#id2

Change-Id: I8ea92dcbb2c195e14704d39fd579c4c579c2b554

'AZLeastRoutersScheduler'), host_descriptions) super(TestHAL3AgentWithAZ, self).setUp(env) def test_ha_router(self): tenant_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() router = self.safe_client.create_router(tenant_id, ha=True) common_utils.wait_until_true( lambda: len(self.client.list_l3_agent_hosting_routers( router['id'])['agents']) == 2, timeout=90) common_utils.wait_until_true( functools.partial( is_ha_router_active_on_one_agent, self.client, router['id']), timeout=90)

commit_message:
redirecting the broken links

Some links are broken because of the doc migration.It is not acceptable to
manually test all links and fix them one by one. we can fix them all by
adding Apache redirect rules.

Change-Id: I2ba401aab5eabd0e3e3be92b3caa8d234494828e

commit_message:
Add l3_agent to devstack/lib

This can be useful for VPNaaS [1], FWaaS [2] and other advance services.

[1] I0b86c432e4b2210e5f2a73a7e3ba16d10467f0f2
[2] neutron-fwaas/devstack/lib/l3_agent

Related-Bug: #1692128
Change-Id: I4a4a5961a5c1428938936db3816801c978addda9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/78/501978/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function plugin_agent_add_l3_agent_extension { local l3_agent_extension=$1 if [[ -z "$L3_AGENT_EXTENSIONS" ]]; then L3_AGENT_EXTENSIONS=$l3_agent_extension elif [[ ! ,${L3_AGENT_EXTENSIONS}, =~ ,${l3_agent_extension}, ]]; then L3_AGENT_EXTENSIONS+=",$l3_agent_extension" fi } function configure_l3_agent { iniset $Q_L3_CONF_FILE AGENT extensions "$L3_AGENT_EXTENSIONS" }

commit_message:
[WIP] Remove CommonDbMixin

WIP! DO NOT MERGE until:
 - all neutron/db/_*.py moved to neutron-lib
 - all consumers stop using CommonDbMixin

Related-Blueprint: neutron-lib

commit_message:
Better handle l3-agent initialization failures

If the l3-agent is adding a new router and has a failure
during ri.process(), that router could be considered added,
even though it is not fully functional.  Any subsequent update
that arrives will not be able to fix this, as it will not be
able to re-do some of the initialization that should have been
done, such as adding the metadata redirect rules.

Instead, cleanup the router and schedule a resync so that
initialization can be re-tried.

Change-Id: Iae80ac57ce5f1fb5be59d761edc2e0d5ab9dd690
Closes-bug: #1735724

commit_message:
add 'ovs_interfaceid' to portbinding vif_details

Passing OVS interface id from neutron to nova is intended in [1]. And
this patch add new prameter 'ovs_interfaceid' to the 'vif_details' in
the portbinding API.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19121/

Depends-On: I7d00f5ffe0b3504dcfd5d0be73f16c50b8b583d6
Change-Id: I90d72293a81eb0e43f3509351c35dfca89a19841
Signed-off-by: Ryota MIBU <r-mibu@cq.jp.nec.com>

subject: Ensure vif_details are unique per VIF
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-24 14:48:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/macvtap/mech_driver/test_mech_macvtap.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/macvtap/mech_driver/mech_macvtap.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/979f57dd26e6a92b38288e710a8d6f66632a7911', 'message': "Ensure vif_details are unique per VIF

The Neutron framework assumes that the details of a vif are the same
cross all nics [1]. But with the macvtap agent they aren't! The vlan
detail might be different for each vif, depending to which network
it belongs to.

The current implementation had a big bug: If first a vif attached to
a vlan network was processed, the 'vlan' was stored in the instance
drivers self.vif_details variable. Now if after that a flat vif is
processed, self.vif_details did still contain the 'vlan' property.
The vif_details (including the vlan property) where sent over to
nova. Due to the 'vlan' property being present, nova was configuring
the macvtap with vlans, even though the vif belonged to a flat network.

The solution is to make a copy of self.vif_details each time we process
it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/7e3d6a18fb928bcd303a44c1736d0d6ca9c7f0ab/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_agent.py#L142,L143

Change-Id: Id7134f933758ee768e13232af326423ac8c03c79
Closes-Bug: #1745159
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure vif_details are unique per VIF

The Neutron framework assumes that the details of a vif are the same
cross all nics [1]. But with the macvtap agent they aren't! The vlan
detail might be different for each vif, depending to which network
it belongs to.

The current implementation had a big bug: If first a vif attached to
a vlan network was processed, the 'vlan' was stored in the instance
drivers self.vif_details variable. Now if after that a flat vif is
processed, self.vif_details did still contain the 'vlan' property.
The vif_details (including the vlan property) where sent over to
nova. Due to the 'vlan' property being present, nova was configuring
the macvtap with vlans, even though the vif belonged to a flat network.

The solution is to make a copy of self.vif_details each time we process
it.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/7e3d6a18fb928bcd303a44c1736d0d6ca9c7f0ab/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_agent.py#L142,L143

Change-Id: Id7134f933758ee768e13232af326423ac8c03c79
Closes-Bug: #1745159

commit_message:
Part II of Integrate Port OVO

This patch integrated Port OVO in db/db_base_plugin_common.py,
db/db_base_plugin_v2.py and some related files. Since Port is
a rather huge object to refactor, other remaining parts will
be addressed in following patches.

commit_message:
Fix invalid dash search in fedora package

This commit fixes devstack when trying to install ovs dependencies. It
tries to install a non-existant kernel-foo package as the is_fedora flag
on devstack doesn't differenciate on Fedora/CentOS/... and currently
this was failing with Fedora 26.

Change-Id: Ibb10f3dbf8370f96e6a5edc2675e06780ab35a28
Closes-Bug: #1716963

commit_message:
Expand get-me-a-network to support any network topology

Improves auto-allocated topology functionality to support
three configuration types: 'auto', 'fixed', and 'circular',
which are set by the admin in the config file.

The admin creates specific networks and gives them the tag
'__auto-allocatable'. Then, if 'fixed' or 'circular' is chosen,
one of these networks is shared with the tenant when the tenant
auto-allocates a network. 'fixed' assigns only one tenant per
network, while 'circular' can assign multiple tenants to each
network if necessary. 'auto' is the same as the previous
functionality, creating a network, subnet, and router.

Related-bug: 1690438

Change-Id: Ie8296055468bbe76b527a57a5fbbb1807ed20139

subject: Fix delete_network() to do BEFORE and PRECOMMIT better
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-05 19:26:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/segments/db.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py', 'neutron/db/external_net_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/74152c5fa75ba66d7d5915292e60c35f8cb5f4a7', 'message': 'Fix delete_network() to do BEFORE and PRECOMMIT better

First, move segment deletion back to PRECOMMIT_DELETE, which
reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd,
"Delete segments on BEFORE_DELETE instead of PRECOMMIT".

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to
BEFORE_DELETE network event has created some bugs. In one of
them, it is not possible to delete a routed network, because
the segments cannot be deleted due to the fact that the
associated subnets still exist.

Making _delete_segments_for_network respond to PRECOMMIT_DELETE
introduces a StaleDataError with the standard attributes of the
deleted segments. To work around that, network_db is expired and
read again after notifying the PRECOMMIT_DELETE event in
delete_network in the DB core plug-in.

Second, create a BEFORE notifier in external_net_db to check if
there are associated floating IPs, so it can fail before we try
and delete the network.  The existing BEFORE notifier can then
be moved to PRECOMMIT.

Third, make _ensure_network_not_in_use() a BEFORE notifier,
since that better fits the design of how it is being used.

Closes-Bug #1697324
Closes-Bug #1732543

Change-Id: I5360847769120e4366629223ca5f93406ef9beb0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix delete_network() to do BEFORE and PRECOMMIT better

First, move segment deletion back to PRECOMMIT_DELETE, which
reverts commit 12d24abba75ab3b926edbac389437bacc23914dd,
"Delete segments on BEFORE_DELETE instead of PRECOMMIT".

Making the callback _delete_segments_for_network respond to
BEFORE_DELETE network event has created some bugs. In one of
them, it is not possible to delete a routed network, because
the segments cannot be deleted due to the fact that the
associated subnets still exist.

Making _delete_segments_for_network respond to PRECOMMIT_DELETE
introduces a StaleDataError with the standard attributes of the
deleted segments. To work around that, network_db is expired and
read again after notifying the PRECOMMIT_DELETE event in
delete_network in the DB core plug-in.

Second, create a BEFORE notifier in external_net_db to check if
there are associated floating IPs, so it can fail before we try
and delete the network.  The existing BEFORE notifier can then
be moved to PRECOMMIT.

Third, make _ensure_network_not_in_use() a BEFORE notifier,
since that better fits the design of how it is being used.

Closes-Bug #1697324
Closes-Bug #1732543

Change-Id: I5360847769120e4366629223ca5f93406ef9beb0

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-12-05 17:09:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ec59daf1eb6928fad3070a04a9b1e65ff2cbceab', 'message': 'Fail early deleting network

In order to not delete the networksegments entry for a network,
we must check the network is not in use before issuing the
BEFORE_DELETE notification.

As a side-effect, this could trigger a false-positive if it
is an external network and there are associated floating IPs
configured on it - the notification code can only deal with
un-associated floating IPs.  So we must check for that condition
before calling the BEFORE_DELETE notifiers.

Change-Id: I29bbee96dc88fb277db597a2467e18954d8782a1
Closes-bug: #1732543
'}]
commit_message:
Fail early deleting network

In order to not delete the networksegments entry for a network,
we must check the network is not in use before issuing the
BEFORE_DELETE notification.

As a side-effect, this could trigger a false-positive if it
is an external network and there are associated floating IPs
configured on it - the notification code can only deal with
un-associated floating IPs.  So we must check for that condition
before calling the BEFORE_DELETE notifiers.

Change-Id: I29bbee96dc88fb277db597a2467e18954d8782a1
Closes-bug: #1732543
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/97/525697/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sqlalchemy import or_ @db_api.retry_if_session_inactive() def _get_associated_floatingips_count(self, context, network_id): fip_model = l3_models.FloatingIP query = model_query.query_with_hooks(context, fip_model) query = query.filter(or_(fip_model.fixed_port_id.isnot(None), fip_model.router_id.isnot(None))) query = query.filter_by(floating_network_id=network_id) return query.count()

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I9ad73265adc673d4ec4f7d412081e07c2cf55715
Story: #2002586
Task: #24337

added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import errno import socket import pyroute2 from pyroute2.netlink import rtnl from pyroute2.netlink.rtnl import ndmsg from pyroute2 import NetlinkError from pyroute2 import netns from neutron._i18n import _ from neutron import privileged from neutron.privileged.agent.linux import ip_lib as priv_ip_lib def _run_iproute_tc(command, device, kind, namespace, **kwargs): try: with priv_ip_lib._get_iproute(namespace) as ip: idx = ip.link_lookup(ifname=device)[0] import remote_pdb; remote_pdb.set_trace(port=1234) return ip.tc(command, kind=kind, index=idx, **kwargs) except IndexError: msg = _("Network interface %(device)s not found in namespace " "%(namespace)s.") % {'device': device, 'namespace': namespace} raise priv_ip_lib.NetworkInterfaceNotFound(msg) except OSError as e: if e.errno == errno.ENOENT: raise priv_ip_lib.NetworkNamespaceNotFound(netns_name=namespace) raise @privileged.default.entrypoint def add_qdisc(device, kind, namespace=None, **kwargs): """Create a device's qdisc. :param device: The name of interface for which qdisc should be added :param kind: The kind of qdisc to add :param namespace: The name of the namespace from which to get the routes """ _run_iproute_tc("add", device, kind, namespace, **kwargs) @privileged.default.entrypoint def add_filter(device, kind, namespace=None, **kwargs): """Create a device's qdisc. :param device: The name of interface for which filter should be added :param kind: The kind of filter to add :param namespace: The name of the namespace from which to get the routes """ _run_iproute_tc("add-filter", device, kind, namespace, **kwargs) @privileged.default.entrypoint def delete_qdisc(device, kind, namespace=None, **kwargs): """Remove a device's qdisc. :param device: The name of interface from which qdisc should be deleted :param kind: The kind of qdisc to remove :param namespace: The name of the namespace from which to get the routes """ try: _run_iproute_tc("del", device, kind, namespace, **kwargs) except (priv_ip_lib.NetworkInterfaceNotFound, priv_ip_lib.NetworkNamespaceNotFound): # If interface or namespace not exists than we are fine and qdisc # is also deleted already return

commit_message:
Add config option endpoint_type for designate

Designate client uses publicURL as default endpoint type, add this
config to use internalURL as endpoint type.
The options of this config are as following in neutron.conf under
[designate]:
     endpoint_type=internalURL or endpoint_type=publicURL

Closes-bug: #1756291

Change-Id: Ibe3de32b6a6e322d8f77b87ade52af40acef340b

commit_message:
Port binding levels extension presented

New extension for representing port binding levels info.
This is the second patch set for neutron.
Another one for neutron_lib where this extension
is defined is at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554508/

No unit tests yet. Work in Progress

Change-Id: I319113edc37573c92a4b4b783de4781a70c27941
Closes-Bug: 1756705
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554508/

commit_message:
ovsfw: Remove add_protocols call

ovsfw is using OF1.0 and the native of_interface has been permitting
OF1.0 for quite some time. Remove this redundant call.

Change-Id: Ibd84cbfa00ac3c1feb77f3464369e28f90e899bc

commit_message:
[WIP][POC] generalize OVSFirewallDriver code

An attempt to make it possible to reuse the driver
code in related projects like neutron-fwaas without
copy-paste approach

Change-Id: Ia930caaf78cf58e7af59c6374520f06e5ee379b3

commit_message:
Use eventlet greenpool to handle notification event for dhcp agent

If a lot of notification event messages are sent to dhcp agent at
the same time, especially port.update.end notification event, it
will result in a very high CPU load for the machine of dhcp agent.

So use eventlet greenpool to control concurrency of notification
event handling.

Change-Id: Ic47d4b8f5ad0ba65bc7fe7c076b268e78eb5fcc9
Closes-Bug: #1766812

subject: Avoid apply firewall if remote sg members update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-05 14:33:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b7c5cb85925b578d325190bc4299f78e0780e35d', 'message': "Avoid apply firewall if remote sg members update

With ipset, When a local agent receives security_groups_member_updated
RPC with remote agent ports, it should only update ipset and shouldn't
reload iptables. This is alternate approach for [1].

In this patch, for security_groups_member_updated RPC, we won't reload
iptables(for both local and remote agent's ports).
When local agent's port security groups are updated, agent will get
port update notification and will reload iptables as part of rpc_loop
processing.

note: working on unit tests

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/122368

Closes-bug: #1371435
Change-Id: Iab92cd19bb14c85f4dddb06ed396f039b16f2e08

commit_message:
Avoid apply firewall if remote sg members update

With ipset, When a local agent receives security_groups_member_updated
RPC with remote agent ports, it should only update ipset and shouldn't
reload iptables. This is alternate approach for [1].

In this patch, for security_groups_member_updated RPC, we won't reload
iptables(for both local and remote agent's ports).
When local agent's port security groups are updated, agent will get
port update notification and will reload iptables as part of rpc_loop
processing.

As we are not reloading iptables for remote sg members update,
l2 agent's rpc_loop will finish faster.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/122368

Co-Authored-By:shihanzhang <shihanzhang@huawei.com>
Closes-bug: #1371435
Closes-bug: #1499177
Change-Id: Iab92cd19bb14c85f4dddb06ed396f039b16f2e08
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/73/351773/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: devices = [] # reload firewalls for only local agent's ports devices = [device['device'] for device in self.firewall.ports.values() if device['device'] in devices_to_update] if self.use_enhanced_rpc: self.firewall.security_group_updated('sg_member', [], devices) self.devices_to_refilter |= set(devices)

commit_message:
Do not turn-off IPv6 forwarding in HA routers if enabled

Changing the value of the IPv6 "all.forwarding" sysctl parameter
will cause an MLDv2 Leave to be sent to indicate we are no longer
a router, but this is unnecessary on an HA router since the
master will have sent a Join to update any upstream router
already.

If we then transition to master and IPv6 forwarding needs to
be enabled, then we must toggle the value to zero and back to 1
so that a Join will be sent. The extra Leave should not cause
any issues.

Related-Bug: #1771841

Change-Id: I5f74a996c92fd69da383baf3c3afe7160f4e5bc8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/569458/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._set_ipv6_forwarding(ip_wrapper, int(ipv6_forwarding)) def _set_ipv6_forwarding(self, ip_wrapper, ipv6_forwarding): """Set ipv6_forwarding via sysctl @param ip_wrapper: an ip_lib.IPWrapper object @param ipv6_forwarding: integer value """ cmd = ['sysctl', '-w', 'net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding=%d' % ipv6_forwarding] ip_wrapper.netns.execute(cmd)

commit_message:
Revert "DVR: Fix allowed_address_pair IP, ARP table update by neutron agent"

This reverts commit fbe308bdc12191c187343b5ef103dea9af738380.

Will revert this commit, since the GARP is not reaching other DVR routers,
then the local one, to update the ARP entry all router namespaces.
This makes the situation worse rather than better.

More details can be found in bug #1773999

Closes-Bug: #1773999

Change-Id: I34c3458668ba0d9eb5e605b3ad0257903b952436
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/41/570941/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Enabling attach subports without specifying segmentation type and id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-18 12:43:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2778ba5c51e481b298486e0d32a56bf577525292', 'message': 'Enabling attach subports without specifying segmentation type and id

This patch proposed to have a default segmentation_type and an
segmentation_id interval so that the user does not mandatory have to
specify the type and the id if it just one to get the default option.
This is similar to how IPs are selected right now when creating a port.

If a segmentation_type and segmentation_id are provided, they are
used as before. However, if no segmentation info is provided, the
default one (in this case the only one available: vlan) is used,
and an available segmenation_id within the defined interval is chosen.
Note there is a random shuffle among the available segmentation
ids to reduce collision probability as well as to speed up the
segmentation_id search.

Change-Id: I093e1cc1b6ba2b8227ecbe9a8cb57f57096252f4

segmentation_id search.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/vlan-aware-vms.html#proposed-change

commit_message:
Enabling attach subports without specifying segmentation type and id

This patch implements the support for making SEGMENTATION-TYPE and
SEGMENTATION-ID optional for trunk-add-subport according to the
spec[1]:
"SEGMENTATION-TYPE and SEGMENTATION-ID are optional in both
trunk-create and trunk-subport-add in the generic case, allowing
neutron server to choose the type and id if needed."

The proposed change makes it not mandatory to have to specify the type
and the id, similarly to how IPs are selected right now when creating
a port. If a segmentation_type and segmentation_id are provided, they
are used as before. However, if no segmentation info is provided, the
default one (in this case the only one available: vlan) is used,
and an available segmentation_id within the defined interval is chosen.
Note there is a random shuffle among the available segmentation
ids to reduce collision probability as well as to speed up the
segmentation_id search.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/vlan-aware-vms.html#proposed-change

Change-Id: I093e1cc1b6ba2b8227ecbe9a8cb57f57096252f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/421880/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Default segmentation type if not provided DEFAULT_SEG_TYPE = 'vlan' MIN_SEG_ID = 1 MAX_SEG_ID = 4094

commit_message:
Remove domains *-log-* from compile_catalog

Translation for logs are being retired [1] and compile_catalog
is failing once they are not found after last zanata import.

commit_message:
Add details of permissions required for listener/rabbitmq

Change-Id: I19ab1f18e820bcc021e71dc8e7a09769aa198b68
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/66/598466/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --------------------------- .. _Notifications: Notifications ============= Aside from periodic reindexing, Searchlight can index in close to real-time by subscribing to oslo.messaging notifications_. To configure services to send them, it's typically only necessary to enable a driver in their configuration files:: [oslo_messaging_notifications] driver = messaging Most notifications are emitted by a service's API but some services also emit them in scheduler or conductor components. Searchlight subscribes to notifications using a listener pool_ so it will not steal notifications from e.g. telemetry projects. .. _notifications: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/Messaging#Emitting_Notifications .. _pool: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/kilo/notification-listener-pools.html RabbitMQ -------- The rabbitmq driver is the most commonly used. The permissions_ required for searchlight are:: * configure: '^(searchlight-listener|openstack|nova|neutron|cinder|glance)$' * write: '^(searchlight-listener)$' * read: '^(searchlight-listener|nova|glance|cinder|neutron|openstack)$' .. _permissions: https://www.rabbitmq.com/access-control.html

commit_message:
ovsfw: Fix occasional network interruption with mark=1 in conntrack

If SG rules change on a port, SG flows on this port will be recreated.
Although all SG flows for this port will be added into OvS flows by
command 'ovs-ofctl add-flows' one-off, but flows will actually be
added into OvS flows one by one.
If there is a packet from outside to VM pass OvS flows when
'set mark=1' flows matched before SG rules flows added.
This will make mark=1 in conntrack for this kind packets and
result is that the establish-reply packets will be blocked.
It's the same situation for packets from VM to outside.

This patch will move 'set mark=1' flows after SG rules flows added
to avoid this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1719769

Change-Id: Ibd122bef53317d58d01119ed77488fbf5399d55a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/25/507725/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _drop_traffic_for_removed_sg_rules_egress(self, port): # Drop traffic for removed sg rules self._add_flow( table=ovs_consts.RULES_EGRESS_TABLE, priority=50, reg_port=port.ofport, ct_mark=ovsfw_consts.CT_MARK_INVALID, actions='drop' ) for ethertype in [constants.ETHERTYPE_IP, constants.ETHERTYPE_IPV6]: self._add_flow( table=ovs_consts.RULES_EGRESS_TABLE, priority=40, dl_type=ethertype, reg_port=port.ofport, ct_state=ovsfw_consts.OF_STATE_ESTABLISHED, actions="ct(commit,zone=NXM_NX_REG{:d}[0..15]," "exec(set_field:{:s}->ct_mark))".format( ovsfw_consts.REG_NET, ovsfw_consts.CT_MARK_INVALID) ) def _drop_traffic_for_removed_sg_rules_ingress(self, port): # Drop traffic for removed sg rules self._add_flow( table=ovs_consts.RULES_INGRESS_TABLE, priority=50, reg_port=port.ofport, ct_mark=ovsfw_consts.CT_MARK_INVALID, actions='drop' ) for ethertype in [constants.ETHERTYPE_IP, constants.ETHERTYPE_IPV6]: self._add_flow( table=ovs_consts.RULES_INGRESS_TABLE, priority=40, dl_type=ethertype, reg_port=port.ofport, ct_state=ovsfw_consts.OF_STATE_ESTABLISHED, actions="ct(commit,zone=NXM_NX_REG{:d}[0..15]," "exec(set_field:{:s}->ct_mark))".format( ovsfw_consts.REG_NET, ovsfw_consts.CT_MARK_INVALID) ) self._drop_traffic_for_removed_sg_rules_ingress(port) self._drop_traffic_for_removed_sg_rules_egress(port)

commit_message:
ml2: make _device_to_port_id more robust

That method responsible to extract for a device string the port id has
been reworked to ensure that full port UUID is going to be returned or
raise a exception.

Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <nate.johnston@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iee03e8fd808ea8237604454f4af5459d9fa156ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/80/506680/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: port_ids_to_devices = {} for device in devices: try: port_ids_to_devices[ self._device_to_port_id(context, device)] = device except exc.PortNotFound: pass """Returns port ID based on device string A device string can be a truncated UUID prefixed by interface like es tapAAABBBCCC, a full UUID representing the port ID or a MAC address. In all cases that method is going to return the full UUID of the port. """ if uuidutils.is_uuid_like(device): # Considering that the device string is the port UUID return device # The device string is not UUID, it could be a MAC or a # truncated UUID prefixed by interface type. truncated_port_id = device[len(prefix):] port = db.get_port(context, truncated_port_id) if not port: raise exc.PortNotFound(port_id=truncated_port_id) # The device string should be a MAC address port = db.get_port_from_device_mac(context, device) if port: return port.id else: raise exc.PortNotFound(port_id=device)
deleted_lines: port_ids_to_devices = dict( (self._device_to_port_id(context, device), device) for device in devices) # REVISIT(rkukura): Consider calling into MechanismDrivers to # process device names, or having MechanismDrivers supply list # of device prefixes to strip. return device[len(prefix):] # REVISIT(irenab): Consider calling into bound MD to # handle the get_device_details RPC if not uuidutils.is_uuid_like(device): port = db.get_port_from_device_mac(context, device) if port: return device

commit_message:
Netlink driver to manage conntrack entries

This patch proposes ConntrackNetlink driver to delete conntrack
entries. Adopt Netlink solution [1] will improve conntrack
management performance.

[1] https://goo.gl/SrsA8z

Closes-Bug: #1630832
Co-Authored-By: Cao Xuan Hoang <hoangcx@vn.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib02e4768b5af0915d9f11cd1ef66a73b06a611f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/12/470912/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.conntrack_driver = self._load_conntrack_driver( self.execute = execute or self.conntrack_driver 'neutron.agent.firewall.linux.conntrack_drivers', driver) def _delete_conntrack_state(self, device_info_list, rules, remote_ip=None): if hasattr(self.execute, 'delete_entries'): for device_info in device_info_list: zone_id = self.get_device_zone(device_info, create=False) if not zone_id: continue self.execute().delete_entries(rules, zone_id) else: for rule in rules: conntrack_cmds = self._get_conntrack_cmds(device_info_list, rule, remote_ip) for cmd in conntrack_cmds: try: self.execute(list(cmd), run_as_root=True, check_exit_code=True, extra_ok_codes=[1]) except RuntimeError: LOG.exception( _LE("Failed execute conntrack command %s"), cmd) def delete_conntrack_state_by_rule(self, device_info_list, rules): self._delete_conntrack_state(device_info_list, rules) device_info_list, [rule], remote_ip) else: self._delete_conntrack_state(device_info_list, [rule])
deleted_lines: self._executor = self._load_conntrack_driver( self.execute = execute or self._executor 'neutron.agent.firewall.linux.conntrack_drivers', driver) def _delete_conntrack_state(self, device_info_list, rule, remote_ip=None): conntrack_cmds = self._get_conntrack_cmds(device_info_list, rule, remote_ip) for cmd in conntrack_cmds: try: self.execute(list(cmd), run_as_root=True, check_exit_code=True, extra_ok_codes=[1]) except RuntimeError: LOG.exception( _LE("Failed execute conntrack command %s"), cmd) def delete_conntrack_state_by_rule(self, device_info_list, rule): self._delete_conntrack_state(device_info_list, rule) device_info_list, rule, remote_ip) else: self._delete_conntrack_state(device_info_list, rule)

commit_message:
Implement basic policy module in code

This commit will prepare for implementing policies in code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html

Change-Id: Ib8320c6919705f514d57ebcaf1218e72da393b69
Co-authored-By: Hieu LE <hieulq@vn.fujitsu.com>

subject: Use existing value for policy enforcement on PUTs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-13 18:51:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/24fa76ae00516f8c4b617b84f43b4335df76dcb8', 'message': 'Use existing value for policy enforcement on PUTs

The Neutron policy enforcement code currently uses the new value
of an attribute (on a PUT request) to validate access to that
same attribute. The reason it does that is because it must specify
a key-value pair for the policy enforcement code to judge whether
or not the role has access to modify it. However, instead of putting
the new value in that key-value pair, it should be using the existing
value fetched from the database, if it exists. If it does not exist,
the key-value pair should be generated and put into the resource
object being modified before the object is passed to the policy
engine. Then after the policy engine validates access successfully,

commit_message:
Use existing value for policy enforcement on PUTs

The Neutron policy enforcement code currently uses the new value
of an attribute (on a PUT request) to validate access to that
same attribute. The reason it does that is because it must specify
a key-value pair for the policy enforcement code to judge whether
or not the role has access to modify it. However, instead of putting
the new value in that key-value pair, it should be using the existing
value fetched from the database, if it exists. If it does not exist,
the key-value pair should be generated and put into the resource
object being modified before the object is passed to the policy
engine. Then after the policy engine validates access successfully,
the object attribute should be given the new value to be put into
the database.

Change-Id: I0c03a66668857ae64af348c75d9a61059c08b058
Closes-Bug: #1779003

Security group Closed but arp spoof still open

When Security group closed, the details in port is also True, so the arp spoof continue

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html
