revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-31 03:54:07.000000000', 'files': ['metadata.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstackclient/commit/7ae001c6c4831abae5e26a811e27f6f1c4c15027', 'message': 'Pin fog-openstack library to avoid breakage

The update of the fog-openstack ruby gem from 0.12.7 to 0.2.0 breaks

something like (extract from a kitchen run of openstack-chef-repo):

  had an error: Fog::Identity::OpenStack::NotFound: Expected([200]) <=>

commit_message:
Pin fog-openstack library to avoid breakage

The update of the fog-openstack ruby gem from 0.12.7 to 0.2.0 breaks
Chef recipes. The first call to cookbook-openstackclient from
cookbook-openstack-identity:recipes/registration.rb fails already with
something like (extract from a kitchen run of openstack-chef-repo):

  ERROR: openstack_domain[default] (openstack-identity::registration line 69)
  had an error: Fog::Identity::OpenStack::NotFound: Expected([200]) <=>
  Actual(404 Not Found)

  (http://127.0.0.1:35357/v3/v3/domains): The resource could not be found.

Change-Id: I4d30cb1770b6774b39bfd4e4c413f25816b405df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstackclient refs/changes/17/598417/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Motivation: prevents false positives caused by test
exceptions matching the expected exception before or
after the ``override_role`` context is called.

This patchset changes expected_error_codes behavior [0] by checking
errors explicitly outside the override_role context. This is done
by introducing a new function to rbac_rule_validation that is
used for validating that the expected exception isn't raised too
early (before ``override_role`` call) or too late (after
``override_call``) or at all (which is a bad test).

This means that exceptions raised prior to override_role
call result in failure. The same goes for exceptions raised
after override_role -- except for those that are an instance
of BasePatroleException (which is valid for things like
RbacMalformedResponse getting raised intentionally).

The new exception that is introduced is called
RbacPrematureException.

Unit tests are added for all validation scenarios described
above.

commit_message:
Limit exception handling to calls within override_role

Motivation: prevents false positives caused by test
exceptions matching the expected exception before or
after the ``override_role`` context is called.

This patchset changes expected_error_codes behavior [0] by checking
errors explicitly outside the override_role context. This is done
by introducing a new function to rbac_rule_validation that is
used for validating that the expected exception isn't raised too
early (before ``override_role`` call) or too late (after
``override_call``) or at all (which is a bad test).

This means that exceptions raised prior to override_role
call result in failure. The same goes for exceptions raised
after override_role -- except for those that are an instance
of BasePatroleException (which is valid for things like
RbacMalformedResponse getting raised intentionally).

The new exception that is introduced is called
RbacOverrideRoleException.

Unit tests are added for all validation scenarios described
above.

[0] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2003297
Story: 2003297
Task: 24246

Co-Authored-By: Felipe Monteiro <felipe.monteiro@att.com>
Change-Id: Iae9a58640463093f6dda20d40261b20051be2820

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Story: #2002586
Task: #24296

commit_message:
treat SIG repositories as official

Repositories managed by SIGs should be treated as official, so include
them when loading the full set of known repositories.

Change-Id: If55dac67542533ddc09e8d998011dccc9b44229d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

added_lines: _GOVERNANCE_SIGS_URL = 'http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/governance/plain/reference/sigs-repos.yaml' # noqa # Project team repositories are organized as # # team: # deliverables: # name: # repos: # - name # raw = requests.get(_GOVERNANCE_URL) data = yaml.safe_load(raw.text) # SIG repositories are organized as # # name: # - repo: name # raw = requests.get(_GOVERNANCE_SIGS_URL) data = yaml.safe_load(raw.text) for sig_name, sig_data in data.items(): for repo in sig_data: name = repo['repo'] if name in seen_repos: continue regular_repos.append({ 'name': name, 'base': name.rsplit('/')[-1], }) seen_repos.add(name)

commit_message:
Verify keystone connection using token

This patch simplifies the keystone connectivity check to just
get a token instead of making another call that internally gets
a token too. This ensures that only the public keystone endpoint
needs to be accesible, by contrast with the previous project or
region list that needed access to the admin keystone endpoint,
which is usually not accesible from within OpenStack VMs.

Closes-Bug: 1789632
Change-Id: Id19a7e7e1662c33dfb5df417ac24d22926227737
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/58/597458/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: from keystoneauth1 import exceptions m_verify_keystone_conn.side_effect = exceptions.http.Unauthorized self.assertEqual(401, resp.status_code)

commit_message:
switch documentation job to new PTI

This is a mechanically generated patch to switch the documentation
jobs to use the new PTI versions of the jobs as part of the
python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I5693dcf746ef6b30ae3c33efbec666cccbc8e0ef
Story: #2002586
Task: #24296

commit_message:
Remove rootwrap.conf file from setup.cfg

https://review.openstack.org/527425 removed etc/rootwrap.conf, but
it did not remove its entry on setup.cfg. Thus, any attempt to do
"python setup.py install" will fail.

Change-Id: I041551fb6efb8fd52ff1eaa55f6b4af6738c4ded

commit_message:
Fix passphrase None errors

At this moment if ca_private_key_passphrase is None loadbalancer
cannot be created due to AttributeError.
Current change adds check for None before encoding.

Story: 2003588

Task: 24896

Change-Id: I40063aa2f96534c12b284f72d16c9f5a72ad1486
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/10/597510/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_sign_cert_passphrase_none(self): # Attempt sign a cert ca_private_key = self.ca_key.private_bytes( encoding=serialization.Encoding.PEM, format=serialization.PrivateFormat.TraditionalOpenSSL, encryption_algorithm=serialization.NoEncryption() ) signed_cert = self.cert_generator.sign_cert( csr=self.certificate_signing_request, validity=2 * 365 * 24 * 60 * 60, ca_cert=self.ca_certificate, ca_key=ca_private_key, ca_key_pass=None, ca_digest=self.signing_digest ) self.assertIn("-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----", signed_cert.decode('ascii')) # Load the cert for specific tests cert = x509.load_pem_x509_certificate( data=signed_cert, backend=backends.default_backend()) # Make sure expiry time is accurate should_expire = (datetime.datetime.utcnow() + datetime.timedelta(seconds=2 * 365 * 24 * 60 * 60)) diff = should_expire - cert.not_valid_after self.assertTrue(diff < datetime.timedelta(seconds=10)) # Make sure this is a version 3 X509. self.assertEqual('v3', cert.version.name) # Make sure this cert is marked as Server and Client Cert via the # extended Key Usage extension self.assertIn(x509.oid.ExtendedKeyUsageOID.SERVER_AUTH, cert.extensions.get_extension_for_class( x509.ExtendedKeyUsage).value._usages) self.assertIn(x509.oid.ExtendedKeyUsageOID.CLIENT_AUTH, cert.extensions.get_extension_for_class( x509.ExtendedKeyUsage).value._usages) # Make sure this cert can't sign other certs self.assertFalse(cert.extensions.get_extension_for_class( x509.BasicConstraints).value.ca)

commit_message:
Add details of permissions required for listener/rabbitmq

Change-Id: Iac0695e848f79f8805729b12b88d3cf8889650d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/63/479363/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --------------------------- .. _Notifications: Notifications ============= Aside from periodic reindexing, Searchlight can index in close to real-time by subscribing to oslo.messaging notifications_. To configure services to send them, it's typically only necessary to enable a driver in their configuration files:: [oslo_messaging_notifications] driver = messaging Most notifications are emitted by a service's API but some services also emit them in scheduler or conductor components. Searchlight subscribes to notifications using a listener pool_ so it will not steal notifications from e.g. telemetry projects. .. _notifications: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo/Messaging#Emitting_Notifications .. _pool: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/kilo/notification-listener-pools.html RabbitMQ -------- The rabbitmq driver is the most commonly used. The permissions_ required for searchlight are:: * configure: '^(searchlight-listener|openstack|nova|neutron|cinder|glance)$' * write: '^(searchlight-listener)$' * read: '^(searchlight-listener|nova|glance|cinder|neutron|openstack)$' .. _permissions: https://www.rabbitmq.com/access-control.html

commit_message:
Prevents deletion of ports for active nodes

Prevents deletion of ironic port of the node whose provision
state is active. User can delete the port of such node's when
the node's are in the maintenance mode.

Co-Authored-By: Kaifeng Wang <kaifeng.w@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I3c2cc8ec5ddb04d7ab829d1341a045da6dee07e3
Closes-Bug: #1694693
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/73/470273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Now user cannot delete the port which is associated to a node whose provision state is active. User can delete the port of such node's only when the node's are in maintenance mode.

commit_message:
Support keystone v3 in devstack

Sets up service_credentials to support keystone v3; this is also
supported on the default configuration.

Change-Id: I761f407ccd325a5f2cb1fca67499910a2012a152
Closes-Bug: #1534403
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/50/276450/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Client credentials. Use v3 iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials auth_plugin v3password iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials auth_url "$KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI_V3" iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials password "$SERVICE_PASSWORD" iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials tenant_name "$SERVICE_TENANT_NAME" iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials project_name "$SERVICE_TENANT_NAME" iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials user_domain_name "Default" iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials project_domain_name "Default" iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials region_name "$REGION_NAME"
deleted_lines: # OpenStack users # FIXME(ekarlso): Make this configurable to support ks v3 also iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials auth_plugin password iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials tenant_name $SERVICE_TENANT_NAME iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials password $SERVICE_PASSWORD iniset $SEARCHLIGHT_CONF service_credentials auth_url $KEYSTONE_AUTH_URI/v2.0

subject: Add RBAC for all referrers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-13 17:14:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/searchlight/commit/b607b046920c167fd7ed5a4314455899e173d8f6', 'message': "Add RBAC for all referrers

Along with referrer access this change expands
RBAC for more combinations as allowed by SWIFT
ACL

Permission	                                    Read ACL options
Read and list for all referrers	                .r:*
Read and list for a user in a specific project  <project_id>:<user_id>
Read and list for a user in every project	    *:<user_name|user_id>
Read and list for every user in a project	    <project_id>:<*>
Read and list for every user in every project	<*>:<*>

Note:

  .rlistings doesn't need filter, since it can be achieved by
  requesting object name field 'only' in the query result, provided
  user has access

  *:* and .r:* are treated same in Searchlight as SL doesn't allow access
  without auth token as in the case of .r:*.

Change-Id: I43b1cb5238a8dcd3f2829ab59b188812543edd68

commit_message:
Add RBAC for all referrers

Along with referrer access this change expands
RBAC for more combinations as allowed by SWIFT
ACL

Permission	                                Read ACL options
Read and list for all referrers	                .r:*
Read and list for a user in a specific project  <project_id>:<user_id>
Read and list for a user in every project	*:<user_id>
Read and list for every user in a project	<project_id>:<*>
Read and list for every user in every project	<*>:<*>

Note:

  .rlistings doesn't need filter, since it can be achieved by
  requesting object name field 'only' in the query result, provided
  user has access

  *:* and .r:* are treated same in Searchlight as SL doesn't allow access
  without auth token as in the case of .r:*.

Change-Id: I43b1cb5238a8dcd3f2829ab59b188812543edd68
Closes-Bug: #1572747

''' all_referrers = ".r:*" all_users = "*:*" all_users_within_project = project_id + ":*" user_within_project = project_id + ":" + user_id user_every_project = "*:" + user_id account_id = self.get_reseller_prefix() + request_context.owner 'x-container-read': [all_referrers, all_users, user_within_project, all_users_within_project, user_every_project]

commit_message:
Add pools to Designate plugin

Nameservers are not being indexed in designate plugin.
Pools is a new concept which will allow grouping of
namesevers to which a zone could be allocated to.
Zones are allocated to a pool based on attributes
which are selected by the appropriate filter.

For updating pools see
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/designate/pools.html

Change-Id: I6ed8a2060b5ef061e3ddb47ceb616d7ed513b10f
Closes-Bug: #1563497

commit_message:
WIP Policy rbac DO NOT MERGE

Postponing until after Newton/indefinitely. It's apparent that the
various services treat policy files differently; glance's allows
everything but filters in code, and neutron's is more complete. We may
need to rethink the approach a bit but it's too late in the release now.

This is very very WIP (and isn't plumbed in yet) but it demonstrates
turning policy checks into RBAC rules. The intent is to replace the
default RBAC queries with policy-based ones if present.

Change-Id: Ia46dbe4ecfaa3b49bdc08d61cc6ad6085415e26e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/70/362470/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Hewlett-Packard Enterprise Development L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from oslo_policy import _checks """Mirror the evaluation of enforcer.enforce but instead of a static check, return a query filter. The 'target' is assumed to be resources in Elasticsearch; creds holds the current user credentials. """ class PolicyRbacException(Exception): pass class PolicyRbacNotAllowed(Exception): pass def policy_to_rbac(rules, rule, creds): return _policy_to_rbac(rules, rules[rule], creds) def _policy_to_rbac(rules, rule, creds): # TODO(sjmc7) In two minds about patching the classes with these functions # but doesn't make a lot of difference in the scheme of things. if isinstance(rule, _checks.FalseCheck): # "!" rule return False elif isinstance(rule, _checks.TrueCheck): # "@" rule return True elif isinstance(rule, _checks.NotCheck): inner = _policy_to_rbac(rules, rule, creds) if inner in (True, False): return not inner return {"not": inner} elif isinstance(rule, _checks.AndCheck): # Returns False if any checks can't pass; True if they all pass; # otherwise a boolean filter query of the sub-rules and_checks = [_policy_to_rbac(rules, rule, creds) for rule in rule.rules] if False in and_checks: # If any rules are False, this can't succeed return False # Remove any 'True's since they're irrelevant and_checks = list(filter(lambda r: r is not True, and_checks)) if and_checks: return { "bool": { "filter": and_checks } } return True elif isinstance(rule, _checks.OrCheck): # Returns False if all checks are False; True if any checks pass; # otherwise a boolean should query of the sub-rules or_checks = [_policy_to_rbac(rules, rule, creds) for rule in rule.rules] if True in or_checks: # If any rules are True, no need to evaluate any of this return True if set(or_checks) == set([False]): # If all rules are False, return False return False if or_checks: return { "bool": { "should": or_checks } } elif isinstance(rule, _checks.RuleCheck): # Reference to another rule return _policy_to_rbac(rules, rules[rule.match], creds) elif isinstance(rule, _checks.RoleCheck): if 'roles' in creds: return rule.match.lower() in [x.lower() for x in creds['roles']] return False elif isinstance(rule, _checks.GenericCheck): # Either a substitution (project_id:%(project_id)s) or a literal # (project_id:abc). try: # Try to substitute e.g. %(project_id)s from creds. # TODO: this won't work with e.g. %(user.name)s match = rule.match % creds except KeyError: # TODO: what to do here? Assume a literal and hope for the best? pass return {"term": {rule.kind: match}} else: raise PolicyRbacException( "Don't know how to interpret policy check rule %s" % rule.__class__.name)

commit_message:
Add simple script to help testing image membership

This is a simple script for working with devstack and glance
image sharing.

Change-Id: Iefbbf8d267a0f0e55740ca43ec2d6810566bf4b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/30/337830/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -e source ~/devstack/openrc admin admin image_name="Admin Image Shared With Demo Project" image_file=$( cd "$(dirname "$0")" ; pwd -P )"/"$(basename "$0") (set -x; openstack image create --container-format bare --disk-format raw --file "$image_file" "$image_name") image_id=`openstack image show "$image_name" -c id -f value` demo_project_id=`openstack project show demo -c id -f value` (set -x; glance member-create "$image_id" "$demo_project_id") source ~/devstack/openrc admin demo (set -x; glance member-update "$image_id" "$demo_project_id" accepted) openstack image list (set -x; glance member-list --image-id "$image_id")

commit_message:
Add rootwrap filter for systemctl control of dnsmasq

The dnsmasq pxe filter takes start/stop commands for the
dnsmasq service as options. Restarting the systemd service
requries root access.

This change adds a rootwrap filter to allow systemctl
control of the dnsmasq service.

NOTE: The systemd service name is the one used in the RDO
distribution. Additional filters may be needed for other
distributions.

Story: 2002818
Task: 24754
Change-Id: Ie961ec4d3b6b65a462e2d2493f5b9240c2bfa7a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/14/593114/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | A new rootwrap filter is now included to allow control of the systemd dnsmasq service used by ironic-inspector. This fixes a permission issue when systemctl commands are used as ``dnsmasq_start_command`` and ``dnsmasq_stop_command`` in the configuration for the dnsmasq pxe filter. See bug `2002818 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2002818>`_. .. Note:: The filter uses the systemd service name used by the RDO distrubution (``openstack-ironic-inspector-dnsmasq.service``).

WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import json import os class FakeSwiftClientSt(object): def __init__(self, storageurl): self.storageurl = storageurl # Load data from file self.accounts = _load_fixture_data('load/accounts.json') self.containers = _load_fixture_data('load/containers.json') self.objects = _load_fixture_data('load/objects.json') def get_account(self): for account in self.accounts: if self.storageurl in account: return account[self.storageurl] def get_container(self, name): for container_account in self.containers: if self.storageurl in container_account: container_dict = container_account[self.storageurl] if name in container_dict: return (container_dict[name][0], container_dict[name][1]) def head_object(self, container_name, object_name): for object_account in self.objects: if self.storageurl in object_account: container_dict = object_account[self.storageurl] if container_name in container_dict: container = container_dict[container_name] if object_name in container: return container[object_name] class FakeSwiftClient(object): def __init__(self): self.DEFAULT_STORAGE_URL = \ "http://127.0.0.1:8080/v1/AUTH_869f32c820ca44ac870d2eaa33c484a9" def get_auth(self): return [self.DEFAULT_STORAGE_URL] class FakeTenant(object): def __init__(self, id, name): self.id = id self.name = name class FakeTenants(object): def __init__(self, tenants_list): self.tenants = tenants_list def list(self): return self.tenants class FakeKeystoneClient(object): def __init__(self): self._tenants = [] tenants = _load_fixture_data('load/tenants.json') for tenant in tenants: fake_tenant = FakeTenant(tenant['id'], tenant['name']) self._tenants.append(fake_tenant) self.tenants = FakeTenants(self._tenants) def _load_fixture_data(name): base_dir = "searchlight/tests/functional/data" with open(os.path.join(base_dir, name), 'r') as f: return json.load(f) def get_fake_swift_client_st(storageurl): return FakeSwiftClientSt(storageurl) def get_fake_swift_client(): return FakeSwiftClient() def get_fake_ks_client(): return FakeKeystoneClient()

subject: Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 10:39:51.000000000', 'files': ['etc/api-paste.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/searchlight/commit/905d78c61b6cd41c106b91e51c2a2bc3cf653829', 'message': 'Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of searchlight.
The purpose of this middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy in front of searchlight.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Idb825af72a13baecd84f40675c1743f12c42d2b3
'}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of searchlight.
The purpose of this middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy in front of searchlight.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Idb825af72a13baecd84f40675c1743f12c42d2b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/06/384406/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Move some of the implementation notes lower

The note about indices is kind of confusing for first time users.
I am moving it lower and changing a little wording to help get
users to the API faster.

Change-Id: I1206b2b73b7ebb291685c715c8c519e33d9014bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/75/379575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Notes ~~~~~ .. note:: The index you see in responses is not a literal ElasticSearch index. Here are a few points to keep in mind: - For architectural reasons (primarily to allow zero-downtime re-indexing), Searchlight doesn't refer to the index directly, but instead uses *index aliases*. The key impact this has on you as a consumer of the API is that you'll see references to aliases, instead of directly to the index, in some Search API responses. - All accesses to ElasticSearch are done through aliases and not directly through an index. For more details on aliases see the `List plugins`_ call. The actual indices behind the aliases are transient, since a new one is created whenever Searchlight is re-indexed. - By default, Searchlight uses a single index named 'searchlight'. An operator, however, may choose to use a different name. Further, an operator may choose to have different resource types indexed into different indices so that, for example, "OS::Cinder::Volume" can have one Elasticsearch index, "OS::Neutron::Net" can have a different Elasticsearch index and "OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup" can have a third separate ElasticSearch index. When this is done, the aliases exposed via the Searchlight API will also change accordingly.
deleted_lines: .. note:: The situation is actually a bit more complicated than we just portrayed it, so in the spirit of full disclosure, here are a few points to keep in mind: - Indices are transient, since a new one is created whenever Searchlight is re-indexed. The name of the index is described below, but a timestamp is appended to the name. All accesses to Elasticsearch are done through aliases and not directly through an index. For more details on aliases see the `List plugins`_ call. - By default, Searchlight uses a single index named 'searchlight'. An operator, however, may choose to use a different name. Further, an operator may choose to have different resource types indexed into different indices so that, for example, "OS::Cinder::Volume" can have one Elasticsearch index, "OS::Neutron::Net" can have a different Elasticsearch index and "OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup" can have a third separate Elasticsearch index. But a default installation will use a single 'searchlight' index. - For architectural reasons (primarily to allow zero-downtime re-indexing), Searchlight doesn't refer to the index directly, but instead uses *index aliases*. The key impact this has on you as a consumer of the API is that you'll see references to aliases, instead of directly to the index, in some Search API responses.

commit_message:
Need to escape colons in query string

Change-Id: I3051d994315daf5ad39ab897f307f8f8c96be628
Closes-Bug: #1565011
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/22/369822/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _escape_queries(query): """We need to escape multiple ':' in a "query" string (NB: not a "query_string"). The first ':' is a delimiter for the name of the field. Any sebsequent ':' needs to be escaped for Elasticsearch. We will recursviely search the query context for embedded clauses containing more dictionaries. """ for key in query.keys(): if isinstance(query[key], dict): # An embedded dict, recursively resolve it. _escape_queries(query[key]) # TODO(ricka) Should we look at all strings, not just # 'query' strings. Should we change the line below # to this: # if isinstance(query[key], str) or # isinstance(query[key], unicode): if key == 'query': q = query[key] if q.count(':') > 1: # Multiple colons, convert them! Keep the first # colon unchanged, and escape the rest. count = q.find(':') new_q = q[:count] + q[count:].replace(':', '\\:') # If the user already escaped, unescape! query[key] = new_q.replace('\\\\:', '\\:') _escape_queries(query)

commit_message:
Add functional tests for env check

* add new tests for `env check` command which interacts with
  existing@openstack platfrom
* merge ``RallyWithSpecifiedDeployment`` class to the
  tests.functional.utils.Rally .

Change-Id: I57ea3cbe8b8b3a1398ea0a2d27d26ae2510b59ec

commit_message:
wheel-index: only create index once

We saw what looks very much like the index generation racing, with
"mv" unable to close the index file ...

Move to a linear strategy so that each host finishes each task before
moving on.  Then add run_once to the index generation so only one of
the hosts in a python2/3 situation creates the index file.

Change-Id: I3761dd9d2ab752e66bcccdd2434405f11535b95f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/97/597997/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # With multiple python2/3 builds, we only need one host to generate # the final index. All hosts should be finished copying under # linear strategy. run_once: True

commit_message:
Adds more validations in create_snapshot

This patch adds more validations in create snapshot, like
host and replication. And removes the check logic
in create_snapshot_in_db method.

Change-Id: I8e5c7664e54116cc9e302e5e7903f4d7b04c836c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/22/577722/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._create_snapshot_in_db_validate(context, volume) if not volume.host: msg = _("The snapshot cannot be created because volume has " "not been scheduled to any host.") raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) if volume['status'].startswith('replica_'): # Can't snapshot secondary replica msg = _("Snapshot of secondary replica is not allowed.") raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg)
deleted_lines: context.authorize(snapshot_policy.CREATE_POLICY, target_obj=volume) if not volume.host: msg = _("The snapshot cannot be created because volume has " "not been scheduled to any host.") raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) if volume['status'] == 'maintenance': LOG.info('Unable to create the snapshot for volume, ' 'because it is in maintenance.', resource=volume) msg = _("The snapshot cannot be created when the volume is in " "maintenance mode.") raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) if self._is_volume_migrating(volume): # Volume is migrating, wait until done msg = _("Snapshot cannot be created while volume is migrating.") raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg) if volume['status'].startswith('replica_'): # Can't snapshot secondary replica msg = _("Snapshot of secondary replica is not allowed.") raise exception.InvalidVolume(reason=msg)

commit_message:
help: added dot at the end of base-arch description

--base-arch option has a list of allowed options listed after help description.

Without change:

  --base-arch BASE_ARCH
                        The base architecture. Default is same as host Allowed
                        values: x86_64, ppc64le, aarch64

With change:

  --base-arch BASE_ARCH
                        The base architecture. Default is same as host.
                        Allowed values: x86_64, ppc64le, aarch64

Change-Id: I53a4edf943a048f8659c71081abcd6dc22809316

commit_message:
Remove mox3 dependencies

Dependency for mox3 is fully removed. So this patch removes mox3
dependency from followings:

- lower-constraints.txt
- test-requirements.txt
- doc/requirements.txt

This should be cherry-picked into stable/rocky branch.

Change-Id: Idd1f095b5f7ae6a4b07153dd7d3587dc18822df6

commit_message:
Extend existing@openstack platform with cert keys

* add support for https_cert and https_key options
* also fix some small issues which appeared after forsing
  using credentials object inside the osclients

Change-Id: Icc885a8b21fd7725009f871c7713a5ce98b60ddb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally-openstack refs/changes/11/595811/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Extended documentation for ``existing@openstack`` plugin which includes accepted system environment variables for ``rally env create --from-sysenv`` action. * ``https_cert`` and ``https_key`` options of the spec for ``existing@openstack`` platform to represent client certificate bundle and key files. Also the support for appropriate system environment variables ( ``OS_CERT``, ``OS_KEY``) is added.

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I694727f5710222283e28aa2684ebf289a6bfd2eb
Story: #2002586
Task: #24296

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ie3e0c1de8e29d2e8e181b73862a88d886ccc0edd

commit_message:
Add always tag to systemd version task

The systemd version task requires an always tag to ensure it runs no
matter the tags provided on the CLI. If a deployer runs the role with
tags and this tag is not set the prep include task file will fail to
load.

Change-Id: Ic513225cdbd0f9fb49e61d499ab5e1ad5577caa5
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add ensure_lbaas_package to neutron::server

Adds a new parameter ensure_lbaas_package same as for the other
service provider plugins. This can be used to only install the
LBaaS package and not the agents so that the neutron-server can
load the plugin.

Change-Id: I7f074fe3f8d3935d18f640de0d8a256f39ea8b11
(cherry picked from commit c70e4fa7f29c4ea183e3dd8f54549a6a0643307b)

added_lines: --- features: - | Added new parameter neutron::server::ensure_lbaas_package that if set to true will install the neutron LBaaS package so that you can load that service_provider.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-29 00:44:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/507c2ef20e071f982e926b5dde52062dff3d5d4e', 'message': 'Retry on MessagingTimeout to init compute RPC API during n-cpu start

When [upgrade_levels]/compute=auto, the RPC ComputeAPI client
gets the minimum nova-compute service version to determine the
RPC API pin version. This requires a roundtrip to conductor. If
nova-compute and conductor are starting around the same time, like
we see in our CI jobs, the call to conductor can hit an RPC
MessagingTimeout and kill the nova-compute service.

This change does two things:

1. Moves the RPC ComputeAPI client initialization to a bit
   later in the nova-compute service startup routine. Note
   that post_start_hook still runs before the service is
   joined to the service group in the service group API.

2. Adds a retry decorator which will retry two for a total
   of three attempts to init the compute RPC API client. Failing
   that, nova-compute will still fail to start as before.

Change-Id: I6dc9bccbd51d7c3cdf3924cc41d87c2ee3f934b3
Closes-Bug: #1789484

commit_message:
Retry on MessagingTimeout to init compute RPC API during n-cpu start

When [upgrade_levels]/compute=auto, the RPC ComputeAPI client
gets the minimum nova-compute service version to determine the
RPC API pin version. This requires a roundtrip to conductor. If
nova-compute and conductor are starting around the same time, like
we see in our CI jobs, the call to conductor can hit an RPC
MessagingTimeout and kill the nova-compute service.

This change does two things:

1. Moves the RPC ComputeAPI client initialization to a bit
   later in the nova-compute service startup routine. Note
   that post_start_hook still runs before the service is
   joined to the service group in the service group API.

2. Adds a retry decorator which will retry for a total
   of three attempts to init the compute RPC API client. Failing
   that, nova-compute will still fail to start as before.

Change-Id: I6dc9bccbd51d7c3cdf3924cc41d87c2ee3f934b3
Closes-Bug: #1789484
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/30/597330/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.compute_rpcapi = None # initialized in post_start_hook def post_start_hook(self): """Hook to provide the manager the ability to do additional start-up work immediately after a service creates RPC consumers and starts 'running'. """ LOG.info('Loading compute RPC API') # Default rpc_response_timeout is 60 seconds so we just retry twice # so at most it would take 3 minutes to make this work or fail. @loopingcall.RetryDecorator(max_retry_count=2, exceptions=(messaging.MessagingTimeout,)) def _load_compute_rpcapi(): # If [upgrade_levels]/compute=auto, RPC ComputeAPI will get the # minimum nova-compute service version *in this cell* and use it # as the RPC API version pin, but it requires a round-trip to # conductor which could hit MessagingTimeout, hence the retry # decorator. self.compute_rpcapi = compute_rpcapi.ComputeAPI() _load_compute_rpcapi()

commit_message:
FWaaS v2 dashbaord: clean up unnecessary get_dict() methods

APIDictWrapper provides to_dict() method, so there is no need
to have get_dict() method in Firewall wrapper API classes.

firewalls_v2.views.RouterCommonView is also unnecessary
as this is not used anywhere.

Change-Id: I760d653aa2404f574755572a90bfcd2bbad9a7bf
Closes-Bug: #1723951

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/595921/
Change-Id: I8a4fe9c5ff93b19e65405e4f4a334009bafdbb0d
Story: #2002586
Task: #24316

commit_message:
Replace noop tests with registration test

Previously the python tests are just some stub code, replace them with
some real tests.

This also includes I630f110810f9f3fbd16eeed0034bb3f665f66075 to make the
gate pass.

Change-Id: I0d8d7213bf1abc690517d14c97f5c312b34b4112

added_lines: from tempest.lib import exceptions from tempest import test credentials = ['primary', 'alt'] cls.alt_client = cls.alt_manager.network_client @decorators.idempotent_id('b45c5ea0-bce2-42f6-b773-c1304df11cba') @test.requires_ext(extension="rbac-policies", service="network") def test_create_port_with_ipaddress_other_tenant(self): self.client.create_rbac_policy( object_type='network', object_id=self.network['id'], action='access_as_shared', target_tenant=self.alt_client.tenant_id) fixed_ip = [{'ip_address': '10.0.0.11'}] self.assertRaises( exceptions.BadRequest, self.alt_client.create_port, self.network, fixed_ips=fixed_ip, tenant_id=self.alt_client.tenant_id) @decorators.idempotent_id('faf3d558-d53f-4d61-b668-7ac4c9482da8') @test.requires_ext(extension="rbac-policies", service="network") def test_create_port_with_subnet_other_tenant(self): network = self.create_shared_network() subnet = self.create_subnet(network, enable_dhcp=False) fixed_ip = [{'subnet_id': subnet['id']}] body = self.create_port(self.network, fixed_ips=fixed_ip, tenant_id=self.alt_client.tenant_id) subnet_id = body['fixed_ips']['subnet_id'] self.assertEqual(subnet['id'], subnet_id)

commit_message:
Adding tests with different mac address for parent and sub ports.

Added same tests while mac address for sub-ports differs from
parent port.

Change-Id: I75a39a5625cb3cc441a913aef8b2d72e9b08f4fd

added_lines: '%(SPMAC)s' name=data_utils.rand_name('secgroup-')) def _create_server_with_port_and_subport(self, vlan_network, vlan_tag, same_macs=True): if same_macs: port_for_subport = self.create_port( vlan_network, security_groups=[self.secgroup['security_group']['id']], mac_address=parent_port['mac_address']) else: port_for_subport = self.create_port( vlan_network, security_groups=[self.secgroup['security_group']['id']]) def _create_test_configuration(self, same_macs): vlan_tag = 10 vlan_network = self.create_network() new_subnet_cidr = get_next_subnet( config.safe_get_config_value('network', 'project_network_cidr')) self.create_subnet(vlan_network, gateway=None, cidr=new_subnet_cidr) servers = [ self._create_server_with_port_and_subport(vlan_network, vlan_tag, same_macs) for i in range(2)] for server in servers: vm_mac_addr = server['subport']['mac_address'] if same_macs is\ False else None self._wait_for_server(server) command = self._get_configure_nic_command(vlan_tag, vm_mac_addr) server['ssh_client'].exec_command(command) out = server['ssh_client'].exec_command( 'PATH=$PATH:/usr/sbin;ip addr list') LOG.debug("Interfaces on server %s: %s", server, out) return servers def _get_configure_nic_command(self, vlan_tag, mac): if mac: command = CONFIGURE_VLAN_INTERFACE_COMMANDS % { 'tag': vlan_tag, 'SPMAC': 'ip l s up dev $IFACE.%(tag)s address %(mac)s && ' % { 'tag': vlan_tag, 'mac': mac, } } else: command = CONFIGURE_VLAN_INTERFACE_COMMANDS % { 'tag': vlan_tag, 'SPMAC': '', } return command def _check_connectivity(self, servers): # Ping from server1 to server2 via VLAN interface should fail because # we haven't allowed ICMP self.check_remote_connectivity( servers[0]['ssh_client'], servers[1]['subport']['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address'], should_succeed=False ) # allow intra-securitygroup traffic self.client.create_security_group_rule( security_group_id=self.secgroup['security_group']['id'], direction='ingress', ethertype='IPv4', protocol='icmp', remote_group_id=self.secgroup['security_group']['id']) self.check_remote_connectivity( servers[0]['ssh_client'], servers[1]['subport']['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address'], should_succeed=True ) def test_subport_connectivity_same_macs(self): servers = self._create_test_configuration(same_macs=True) self._check_connectivity(servers=servers) @testtools.skipUnless( CONF.neutron_plugin_options.image_is_advanced, "Advanced image is required to run this test.") @decorators.idempotent_id('a8a02c9b-b453-49b5-80a2-cce7da67aafc') def test_subport_connectivity_different_macs(self): servers = self._create_test_configuration(same_macs=False) self._check_connectivity(servers=servers)

commit_message:
check bulk port for binding data

There was a bug that prevented the post_op data to be included in the
bulk operations. This test will prevent regressing on it.

Depends-On: I7221f8050cff12f02f39cd8b13db735ab0dd92d4
Change-Id: Ie29ee0d4c43c031a70d38543e8d0aed41f39636c
Related-Bug: #1696051
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Don't enable bluestore by default for Jewel

The previous commit to enable bluestore by default incorrectly
used the Jewel version series for the on by default check.

Update this to specify Luminous (12.2.0).

Change-Id: I8e69b171c67e7c0988c2b25f28fc5bac14de1c5e

commit_message:
Pass in rndc key to Designate deployment

We can't let puppet generate the key because then we end up with a
different key on each system and they can't talk to each other.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/582366
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/583658
Change-Id: Id3dfc9f28e4d204716328eaa9650ab0053d2fdd4

commit_message:
Open designate-mdns ports in firewall

For ha this is necessary so BIND servers on other nodes can request
zone transfers from mdns services that aren't on their local system.

Change-Id: Ia87be3b94eebedccadec2b2ff6d2687dcfb9d87a

commit_message:
Run designate pool update only on bootstrap node

If this is run on all nodes it can cause collisions while updating
the database.

Change-Id: I1dcb28aac111189eec142c6b4c8879431f72094b

commit_message:
Remove uneececary conditionals in network-environment jinja

In the environment/network-environment*.yaml files the
itaration is done only on networks that is enabled.

We do not need conditionals inside the loop to check
wheather the network is enabled or not.

Change-Id: I621c205aebcdb353ac487a5804bbe83fbc20c95d

commit_message:
Enhance SimpleCryptoPlugin

This spec proposes an enhancement to SimpleCryptoPlugin to remove the
encryption key from the barbican.conf file.

Change-Id: I6c70e457a1cae2ae4f6d226a4e047e0b05e76e8d
SecurityImpact
DocImpact
APIImpact
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs refs/changes/28/431228/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Enhance SimpleCryptoPlugin ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/barbican/+spec/enhance-simple-crypto Enhance the SimpleCryptoPlugin to remove the encryption key from the configuraiton file. Problem Description =================== Barbican does not have a production-ready out-of-the-box secert storage backend. The lack of such a backend plugin is hurting Barbican adoption because deployers are currently required to either deploy DogTag in addition to Barbican, or spend a considerable amount of money to acquire a Hardware Security Module (HSM). As of the Ocata release, the SimpleCryptoPlugin backend for Barbican is useful for development, but not suitable for use in production. One of the main reasons why we recommend that SimpleCryptoPlugin not be used in production is the fact that the plugin requires that the encryption key be stored in plaintext in the barbican.conf file. In an HA deployment, the key is stored in plain text in every API node. An attacker with read access to the configuration file in any API node would be able to read the encryption key as well as the database credentials. With this information an attacker could dump the encrypted contents of the database and use the encryption key to decrypt all secrets stored there. Proposed Change =============== This spec proposes to enhance the SimpleCryptoPlugin by removing the encryption key from the configuration file. The encryption key should instead be generated during the initial configuration of a Barbican deployment. A Barbican service administrator (service-admin) should initialize the new encryption key as part of the inital setup by running a new command in barbican-manage. barbican-manage simple-crypto create-key [--shares=S --threshold=T] The create-key subcommand should create a new random AES master encryption key (MKEK) as well as a new shared AES key (SKEK). The subcommand should use the SKEK to encrypt the MKEK and store the cyphertext in the database. The SKEK should then be split into multiple keys using Shamir's Secret Sharing algorithm. [1] The create-key subcommand should then return the S different pieces of key-pieces of the SKEK, where N could be optionally configurable. The N key pieces would then be returned by the subcommand. When starting the barbican API, the threshold T amount of key pieces will be needed to reconstruct the SKEK and decrypt the MKEK that is stored in the database. The different key piece holders could individually submit their key pieces via a new API call. Alternatives ------------ One alternative is to develop a new CryptoPlugin instead of modifying SimpleCryptoPlugin. Another alternative is to avoid Shamir's Secret Sharing altogether. For such an approach, the new encryption key could be created as part of the initial setup by running a new command in barbican-manage: barbican-manage simple-crypto create-key For this alternative, the subcommand would create a new random AES master encryption key MKEK and store a hash of the key in the database (bcrypt?). The MKEK would then be returned by the subcommand. When starting the barbican API, the MKEK would be submitted via a new API call. Barbican will compute the hash of the submitted MKEK to verify it's the same key that was generated during the initial setup. If the hash checks out Barbican will use the MKEK and contiue as usual. Data model impact ----------------- A new table will be needed to store the SKEK(MKEK) cyphertext as well as metadata about the key. REST API impact --------------- When the Barbican API starts up the MKEK will not be available until all T pieces of the SKEK are submitted to the API node. During this time all API operations that require the MKEK (such as encrypt/decrypt) will return an error response with status 503 - Service Unavailable. Additionally, we will need a new API call to submit SKEK pieces. POST /v1/simple-crypto/shared-key { "shared_key": "SHARED_KEY_PIECE_HERE" } Responses: 202 - Accepted 401 - Forbidden 404 - Not Found (when SimpleCryptoPLugin is not enabled) We may also need to get the status of the shared-key GET /v1/simple-crypto/shared-key Responses: Response when threshold T key pieces have been submitted 200 - OK { "shared_key": "ACTIVE", "threshold": 3 } Response when less than threshold T key pieces have been submitted 200 - OK { "shared_key": "PENDING", "threshold": 3 } Security impact --------------- This is a big change to the security model of the SimpleCrypto plugin. We should ask the OpenStack Security Project for help with a new Threat Analysis of Barbican configured to use the enhanced SimpleCrypto plugin. Notifications & Audit Impact ---------------------------- All requests serviced by the new API as well as the actions taken by the new barbican-manage subcommand should be audited and logged. Python and Command Line Client Impact ------------------------------------- This spec includes changes to the barbican-manage CLI tool. A change to the openstackclient plugin will be necessary so that service-admins can submit their key pieces using the openstack CLI. Other end user impact --------------------- The only impact to end users will be the 503 responses when the API process is running without a MKEK. Performance Impact ------------------ This change will affect HA deployments where there is more than one API node. Currenlty, API nodes in an HA deployemnt work in isolation and are not aware of each other. Beacuse of this, the key pieces will have to be submitted individually to each and every API node. Other deployer impact --------------------- The key pieces (or the full MKEK described in the alternative) will have to be stored somewhere external to Barbican. Developer impact ---------------- No impact to other developers Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Douglas Mendizbal Work Items ---------- * Implement (or find a good library for) Shamir's Secret Sharing algorithm. * Add API calls * Add new barbican-manage subcommand * Document changes Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Our devstack plugin will have to be changed to generate the SKEK pieces and submit them to the API when starting Barbican. Documentation Impact ==================== Document new API calls, as well as a guide to configuring a new deployment and generating the SKEK pieces. References ========== This spec is inspired by the Seal/Unseal feature in Hashicorp Vault. https://www.vaultproject.io/docs/internals/architecture.html Shamir's Secret Sharing Algorithm [1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shamir's_Secret_Sharing

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I3bfa57c817c92684044859b80786d37a55d66283
Story: #2002586
Task: #24304

commit_message:
bump ansible from 2.5.5 to 2.5.8

Avoids pause module exception with redirected console.

See: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/41717

Pausing for 30 seconds
(ctrl+C then 'C' = continue early, ctrl+C then 'A' = abort)
An exception occurred during task execution. To see the full traceback,
use -vvv. The error was: error: (25, 'Inappropriate ioctl for device')

Change-Id: I6914bf623deda0d257ba6a2f56b4e220a7931e06

commit_message:
Report client: _reshape helper, placement min bump

Add a thin wrapper to invoke the POST /reshaper placement API with
appropriate error checking. This bumps the placement minimum to the
reshaper microversion, 1.30.

Change-Id: Idf8997d5efdfdfca6967899a0882ffb9ecf96915
blueprint: reshape-provider-tree
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/34/585034/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RESHAPER_VERSION = '1.30' def strict_post(self, *args, **kwargs): @safe_connect def safe_post(celf, *args, **kwargs): return celf.post(*args, **kwargs) resp = safe_post(self, *args, **kwargs) if resp is None: # safe connect bogosity raise exception.PlacementAPIConnectFailure() return resp def _reshape(self, context, inventories, allocations): """Perform atomic inventory & allocation data migration. :param context: The security context :param inventories: A dict, keyed by resource provider UUID, of: { "inventories": { inventory dicts, keyed by resource class }, "resource_provider_generation": $RP_GEN } :param allocations: A dict, keyed by consumer UUID, of: { "project_id": $PROJ_ID, "user_id": $USER_ID, "consumer_generation": $CONSUMER_GEN, "allocations": { $RP_UUID: { "resources": { $RC: $AMOUNT, ... } }, ... } } :raises: ReshapeFailed if the POST /reshaper request fails. :raises: PlacementAPIConnectFailure if @safe_connect fails. """ # We have to make sure any new resource classes exist for invs in inventories.values(): self._ensure_resource_classes(context, list(invs['inventories'])) payload = {"inventories": inventories, "allocations": allocations} resp = self.strict_post('/reshaper', payload, version=RESHAPER_VERSION, global_request_id=context.global_id) if not resp: raise exception.ReshapeFailed(error=resp.text) return resp

subject: Filter args dict in JSONFormatter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-27 17:54:01.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/formatters.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log/commit/a93c6ef98c8aeddc5a4ae87083689225fbc728bb', 'message': 'Filter args dict in JSONFormatter

In most formatters, any unused keys in the args dict will just be
discarded.  Because JSONFormatter logged the entire dict in addition
to the message, some values were included in the output that may
not have been intended.  This could include sensitive data, so we
should stop that.

In the interest of maintaining compatibility with any tools that are
reading the args dict, we leave the dict but filter out any unused
keys.

Change-Id: Ib64837c1ae93a27bef3d30a776320a373f18dd1c
Closes-Bug: 1571714
Closes-Bug: 1787214
'}]
commit_message:
Filter args dict in JSONFormatter

In most formatters, any unused keys in the args dict will just be
discarded.  Because JSONFormatter logged the entire dict in addition
to the message, some values were included in the output that may
not have been intended.  This could include sensitive data, so we
should stop that.

In the interest of maintaining compatibility with any tools that are
reading the args dict, we leave the dict but filter out any unused
keys.

Change-Id: Ib64837c1ae93a27bef3d30a776320a373f18dd1c
Closes-Bug: 1571714
Closes-Bug: 1787214
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/50/596850/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_extra_args_filtered(self): test_msg = 'This is a %(test)s line %%(unused)' test_data = {'test': 'log', 'unused': 'removeme'} self.log.debug(test_msg, test_data) data = jsonutils.loads(self.stream.getvalue()) self.assertNotIn('unused', data['args']) def test_entire_dict(self): test_msg = 'This is a %s dict' test_data = {'test': 'log', 'other': 'value'} self.log.debug(test_msg, test_data) data = jsonutils.loads(self.stream.getvalue()) self.assertEqual(test_data, data['args'])

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

commit_message:
SIO: Clean up padded volume comments

There were a couple of spots still referring specifically to thick
provisioned volumes as being an issue without padding enabled. This is
an issue regardless of provisioning type, so this cleans up those
mentions.

Change-Id: Ife3e6cabe9ce3ba2090fc23c02c4d40493586320
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Notify about deprecated neutron::services::lbaas

The neutron::services::lbaas class has been deprecated for a
long time but we never notified users.

I have pushed the functionality to neutron::server in [1] to follow
the actual standard we have.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/597453/

Change-Id: I282ceb7e2ca469fce358747930b9d7b863f188db

commit_message:
Use mirrored etcd container for openshift CI

We need to use the fedora etcd container for openshift, because we
require the default user to be root[1]. However, this registry is not
mirrored in openstack infra, so we end up getting timeouts. The
fedora container has been manually copied into our docker.io registry
which is mirrored and will not have the same timeout issues.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/576497

Depends-On: I48fcbcfba5e8b41f28e23773e2cc02229f7eee7d
Depends-On: I8e6bc6d46a32a55098991e1916cedebb7e0b5c93
Change-Id: Idfbaf756c49957219ab1f526a2666b43aaddce8b

commit_message:
Amendment of the agent http provisioning spec

During spec[0] implementation, there are several findings related to
performance. This patch updates the image conversion rule to avoid
the situation when stream_raw_images and force_raw_images are both set
to true. Some descriptive text are added with regards to the options
that may affect performance.

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/not-implemented/agent-http-provisioning.html

Change-Id: I26179155f613e0bb694aa202094e0c52c0528131
Story: #1598852
Task: #10474
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/45/593545/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cached by direct deploy interfaceThe instance image cached by ``direct`` deploy interface will not be affected by ``CONF.force_raw`` configuration option, due to two reasons below: * The checksum recalculation of a raw image could have a severe performance impact on the conductor node, because the image size could be huge. Besides, raw image will consume more network bandwidth, though same as ``iscsi`` deploy interface, they deviates the purpose to achieve better performance by adopting agent-based deploy interfaces. * Agent-based deploy interfaces download whole instance image into memory before write to disk, this will lead to failed deployment due to insufficient memories on baremetals. To avoid introducing another instance cache, this spec proposes updating image cache to take ``CONF.force_raw`` into account for the image name: * Images downloaded with ``CONF.force_raw`` set to ``True`` will have a ``.raw`` as file extension. * Images downloaded with ``CONF.force_raw`` set to ``False`` keep with current file naming. The expected space usage basically should be no more than ``iscsi`` deploy interface.on each conductor node. The consumption should be smaller than ``iscsi`` deloy interface.
deleted_lines: The expected space usage basically should be the same with ``iscsi`` deploy interface.on each conductor node. Substantially the consumption should be equivalent with the ``iscsi`` deploy interface if ``[DEFAULT]force_raw_images`` is set to true.

commit_message:
DVR: Add IPv6 csnat port address correctly

If router gateway info update, in l3_dvr_db will receive events,
We will get subnets from router attached DVR port, if exists
multiple IPv6 slaac-enabled subnets, previous code will create
csnat port form one of the IPv6 subnets.
This is inconsistency with router interface
udpate in _update_snat_v6_addrs_after_intf_update.

This patch adds all IPv6 subnets if the distributed
router port have multiple IPv6 subnets.

Change-Id: I02ffed238897ebc91b96aebb7f94ed90b7613769
Closes-Bug: #1786169

commit_message:
Adding designate worker and producer to Rocky

Created class DesignateCharmRocky with designate
worker and producer as part of package and service
lists. Tested upgrade as follows:
1) run gate-basic-bionic-queens
2) juju config upgrades to bionic-rocky
3) run dev-basic-bionic-rocky

Change-Id: I2b49ef7db272135b0796182bbe894a9611d96dea
Closes-Bug: #1773190

commit_message:
Add octavia::neutron to configure nova section

Adds new class octavia::neutron that can be used to
configure the neutron section in octavia.conf

Change-Id: I124a1a02afaf9f937b1e57d0362db53eeb026954
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-octavia refs/changes/14/598114/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'octavia::neutron' do shared_examples 'octavia::neutron' do context 'with default parameters' do it { should contain_octavia_config('neutron/service_name').with_value('<SERVICE DEFAULT>') should contain_octavia_config('neutron/endpoint').with_value('<SERVICE DEFAULT>') should contain_octavia_config('neutron/region_name').with_value('<SERVICE DEFAULT>') should contain_octavia_config('neutron/endpoint_type').with_value('<SERVICE DEFAULT>') } end context 'with specified parameters' do let :params do { :service_name => 'networking', :endpoint => 'http://127.0.0.1:9696', :region_name => 'RegionOne', :endpoint_type => 'internalURL', } end it { should contain_octavia_config('neutron/service_name').with_value('networking') should contain_octavia_config('neutron/endpoint').with_value('http://127.0.0.1:9292') should contain_octavia_config('neutron/region_name').with_value('RegionOne') should contain_octavia_config('neutron/endpoint_type').with_value('internalURL') } end end on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge(OSDefaults.get_facts()) end it_behaves_like 'octavia::neutron' end end end

commit_message:
Add octavia::nova to configure nova section

Adds new class octavia::nova that can be used to
configure the nova section in octavia.conf

Change-Id: I7d271c0184750aa90be59a25944c29fec3c3afd2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-octavia refs/changes/12/598112/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # == Class: octavia::nova # # Setup and configure octavia.conf nova section. # # === Parameters: # # [*service_name*] # (Optional) The name of the nova service in the keystone catalog. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*endpoint*] # (Optional) Custom nova endpoint if override is necessary. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*region_name*] # (Optional) Region in catalog to use for nova. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*endpoint_type*] # (Optional) Endpoint type in catalog to use for nova. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*availability_zone*] # (Optional) Availability zone to use for creating Amphorae. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*enable_anti_affinity*] # (Optional) Enable anti-affinity in nova. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*anti_affinity_policy*] # (Optional) Set the anti-affinity policy to what is suitable. # Nova supports: anti-affinity and soft-anti-affinity. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # class octavia::nova ( $service_name = $::os_service_default, $endpoint = $::os_service_default, $region_name = $::os_service_default, $endpoint_type = $::os_service_default, $availability_zone = $::os_service_default, $enable_anti_affinity = $::os_service_default, $anti_affinity_policy = $::os_service_default, ) { include ::octavia::deps octavia_config { 'nova/service_name': value => $service_name; 'nova/endpoint': value => $endpoint; 'nova/region_name': value => $region_name; 'nova/endpoint_type': value => $endpoint_type; 'nova/availability_zone': value => $availability_zone; 'nova/enable_anti_affinity': value => $enable_anti_affinity; 'nova/anti_affinity_policy': value => $anti_affinity_policy; } }

commit_message:
Move rocky implemented specs

This moves the completed rocky specs to the implemented
directory, adds the redirects and also removes the rocky-template
symlink from the approved directory and docs.

This was done using:

  $ tox -e move-implemented-specs -- rocky

Change-Id: I298d6d106f392b662930be97bf88637f1056c0d8

commit_message:
Save and verify allocation and inventory values for nova/placement

This makes the nova resources module save information about the host
inventory (first node only), as well as the allocation information
about the test instance before the upgrade. Afterwards in the
verify phase, we compare those values to the current ones to make
sure we have not lost or changed anything during the upgrade.

Change-Id: Ifef2acf7dce17d0fa21baac9da6f8403e69136a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/06/597206/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function _get_inventory_value() { local key local provider # Cheap at assume only one node for the moment provider=$(openstack resource provider list -f value | head -n1 | cut -d ' ' -f 1) openstack resource provider inventory list -f value | grep "^$key" | cut -d ' ' -f 3) } function _get_allocation_value() { local key local consumer openstack resource provider allocation show -f value $consumer | grep ".${key}.: [0-9]*" | cut -d ' ' -f 2 } # Save some inventory and allocation values resource_save nova nova_inventory_MEMORY_MB $(_get_inventory_value MEMORY_MB) resource_save nova nova_inventory_VCPUS $(_get_inventory_value VCPUS) resource_save nova nova_server_allocation_MEMORY_MB $(_get_allocation_value $uuid MEMORY_MB) resource_save nova nova_server_allocation_VCPUS $(_get_allocation_value $uuid VCPUS) resource_save nova nova_server_allocation_DISK_GB $(_get_allocation_value $uuid DISK_GB) local key local uuid local sval local cval uuid=$(resource_get nova nova_server_uuid) for key in MEMORY_MB VCPUS; do cval=$(_get_inventory_value $key) sval=$(resource_get nova nova_inventory_$key) if [ "$cval" != "$sval" ]; then die $LINENO "Checking inventory value ${key}=${sval} does not match current value ${cval}" fi done for key in MEMORY_MB VCPUS DISK_GB; do cval=$(_get_allocation_value $uuid $key) sval=$(resource_get nova nova_server_allocation_$key) if [ "$cval" != "$sval" ]; then die $LINENO "Checking allocation value ${key}=${sval} does not match current value ${cval}" fi done

subject: Remove jobs settings for monasca-notification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-30 06:54:40.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/2373c397e0e35d5d5b7c76b589b4a54f1f3777e8', 'message': "Remove jobs settings for monasca-notification

Remove jobs settings for monasca-notification

Beside stable/ocata all Zuul config imports are merged.
In stable/ocata monasca-notification won't work with Python 3.5.

Change-Id: Ic274e79ded4ec21964a3fdc54810489729411e8c

commit_message:
Remove confusing mention of WSGI_MODE

Setting WSGI_MODE was removed in change
Ib504ab21dfc5e32eb3f73f57d636981963e20520, but left the comment
about setting it, which blows my mind, man, so let's remove it.

Change-Id: I50e5be2a661bcec73a78246684c334c23ea01aa8

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I66712ed925e07ee3032605790f324a35e0ed46a3
Story: #2002586
Task: #24314

commit_message:
Update status to active when locations replaced

Image status should be changed from 'queued' to 'active' when
'locations' has been successfully replaced.

Change-Id: I966688e67475e00a1eeb0cbe1632d5c811e41e4f
Closes-Bug: 1750892

commit_message:
Report client: get_allocations_for_provider_tree

The reshaper path needs to pass all the allocations related to the
compute node's provider tree to update_provider_tree so it can shuffle
those allocations appropriately. This patch adds a new
get_allocations_for_provider_tree method to the report client for this
purpose.

Blueprint: reshape-provider-tree

Change-Id: I73811f3e3bf19dec3a240e1f1f8c69f4c98d677c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/48/584648/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_allocations_for_provider_tree(self, context, nodename): """Retrieve allocation records associated with all providers in the provider tree. This method uses the cache exclusively to discover providers. The caller must ensure that the cache is populated. :param context: The security context :param nodename: The name of a node for whose tree we are getting allocations. :returns: A dict, keyed by consumer UUID, of allocation records: { $CONSUMER_UUID: { # The shape of each "allocations" dict below is identical # to the return from GET /allocations/{consumer_uuid} "allocations": { $RP_UUID: { "generation": $RP_GEN, "resources": { $RESOURCE_CLASS: $AMOUNT, ... }, }, ... }, "project_id": $PROJ_ID, "user_id": $USER_ID, "consumer_generation": $CONSUMER_GEN, }, ... } :raises: PlacementAPIConnectFailure if @safe_connect fails :raises: ResourceProviderAllocationRetrievalFailed if a placement API call fails. :raises: ValueError if there's no provider with the specified nodename. """ # We can't get *all* allocations for associated sharing providers # because some of those will belong to consumers on other hosts. So we # have to discover all the consumers associated with the providers in # the "local" tree (we use the nodename to figure out which providers # are "local"). # All we want to do at this point is accumulate the set of consumers we # care about. consumers = set() for u in self._provider_tree.get_provider_uuids(name_or_uuid=nodename): alloc_info = self.get_allocations_for_resource_provider(context, u) # The allocations dict is keyed by consumer UUID consumers.update(alloc_info.allocations) # Now get all the allocations (which will include allocations on # sharing providers) for each of these consumers to build the result. return {consumer: self.get_allocs_for_consumer(context, consumer) for consumer in consumers}

commit_message:
Fix incorrect log resources querying

This patch aims to fix a co-existence problem between security_group
and firewall_group log resources due to incorrect log querying from
database.

Change-Id: Ic60ad436e0fbb23cdae0e63eaeb73130ebf02089
Closes-Bug: #1787119

commit_message:
Fix race condition in reshaper handler

Fix the race condition identified at [1] by indexing the `inventories`
argument to the resource_provider.reshape method by ResourceProvider
object rather than its UUID. That means we never have to do a fresh
lookup for the provider.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585033/18/nova/api/openstack/placement/objects/resource_provider.py@4195

Change-Id: Ie21bddc186364db2b10af45546c35b9ad5a0208b

to this document as a good introduction and commentary on best
practices.

commit_message:
Explicitly link to the HTTP RFCs

In the opening we advise people to use the HTTP RFCs as the ultimate
authority but do not link to them. This change adds the links and
generalizes the warning to the entirety of the guidelines, not just
to non-JSON apis.

Change-Id: I40a59594a477d6802a16d8b0ca11020629eff292

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I59f4cbc0a21b8be3a1cae28a64f90d5adcf6be24
Story: #2002586
Task: #24337

commit_message:
Add OctaviaEventStreamerDriver and change default

octavia::health_manager::event_streamer_driver is forcely set to
'queue_event_streamer' with no option to change it. The event streamer
specifies which driver to use for syncing Octavia and Neutron LBaaS
databases. It is highly recommended to disable if one doesn't need to
sync the database or is running Octavia in standalone mode by setting
event_streamer_driver to noop_event_streamer.

Change-Id: I400ce9a059aba195cdd987ba51360ef3d7f258f3
Closes-Bug: #1787608
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/83/593083/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OctaviaEventStreamDriver: type: string default: "noop_event_streamer" description: Name of the event streamer driver to use for syncing Octavia and Neutron LBaaS databases. It is highly recommended to disable if one doesn't need to sync the database or is running Octavia in standalone mode by setting to noop_event_streamer. octavia::health_manager::event_streamer_driver: {get_param: OctaviaEventStreamerDriver}

commit_message:
Switch to workflow driven image prepare

This tests container-prepare-workflow and concludes the coding/testing
portion of this blueprint.

Since image prepare happens during overcloud deploy, the role
overcloud-prep-containers is skipped completely from rocky onwards.
The file containers-prepare-parameter.yaml is written out during
undercloud-deploy.

Change-Id: I006e48754ed1710ae8cc6e9c1d35e9c2e66b5907
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Add ability to create plan using default templates

This change introduces an option to use default templates in
NewPlan form. Using this option results in plan created from
files located at /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat0-templates

added_lines: /** * Copyright 2018 Red Hat Inc. * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may * not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain * a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ import React from 'react'; import PropTypes from 'prop-types'; import { defineMessages, injectIntl } from 'react-intl'; import { Field } from 'redux-form'; import HorizontalStaticText from '../ui/forms/HorizontalStaticText'; import HorizontalDirectoryInput, { validateDirectoryInput } from '../ui/reduxForm/HorizontalDirectoryInput'; import TabPane from '../ui/TabPane'; const messages = defineMessages({ planFiles: { id: 'EditPlanFieldsTab.planFiles', defaultMessage: 'Plan Files' }, planName: { id: 'EditPlanFieldsTab.planName', defaultMessage: 'Plan Name' }, directoryInputDescription: { id: 'EditPlanFieldsTab.directoryInputDescription', defaultMessage: 'Provide a directory with files you want to update, the directory structure must map the plan directory structure.' } }); const PlanFieldsTab = ({ active, intl: { formatMessage }, planName }) => ( <TabPane isActive={active}> <HorizontalStaticText title={formatMessage(messages.planName)} text={planName} inputColumnClasses="col-sm-7" labelColumnClasses="col-sm-3" /> <Field id="files" name="files" component={HorizontalDirectoryInput} label={formatMessage(messages.planFiles)} labelColumns={3} validate={validateDirectoryInput} description={formatMessage(messages.directoryInputDescription)} required /> </TabPane> ); PlanFieldsTab.propTypes = { active: PropTypes.bool.isRequired, intl: PropTypes.object, planName: PropTypes.string.isRequired }; PlanFieldsTab.defaultProps = { active: false }; export default injectIntl(PlanFieldsTab);
